Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: Family of four. Stayed here three nights. Great location. Literally 5 min walk to the massive Phoenix convention centre, the US Airways Centre, and Chase Field. Many little restaurants nearby. Room was fine, rates were good although we were here for a major basketball tournament so got a group rate. Hotel pool, lobby, rooms all fine. Cute lil bagel shop on main floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: docyjk
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights and were impressed with the emphasis on comfort and staff attention. Food selections are good, and the hotel itself is in the center of things downtown within easy walking distance to the stadium. The rooms are getting a little worn looking and the towels were paper thin, but the bed was comfortable. They make an effort to keep the noise volume in the hallways down through guest reminders - not that some people were thoughtless anyway! We would stay there again when we need to be in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is Nice... Room is a different story”
Reviews.Author: LaiLaiGirl
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up to the hotel, all I could think was "Wow." The lobby is large and has plenty of comfy seating. The front desk personnel and concierge were first-class. Then we got to our room on the 17th floor and opened the door. Initially, I was impressed with the room. The king-sized bed looked comfy and inviting, the granite countertop in the bathroom looked classy, and the view of downtown Phoenix was a great sight. But once you lay on the comfy bed and stare at the popcorn ceilings or go into the bathroom and see the 80s-style wood laminate cabinets holding up the granite, the room loses its shine. It was a 95-degree day. Forget about fidgeting with the air conditioner, which apparently stays at "70" (it felt warmer to me). The best "air conditioner" is to close the heavy drapes! Other than the room itself, the location is great. It is within walking distance to Chase field, US Airways Arena and bars, bars, bars! If sports and/or drinking are not your thing, then there's not much else for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SunSandH20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hyatt hotel for four nights while I was attending a business conference. I found the hotel to be a good value with a central location. All of the staff members I came in contact with were professional.

Reviews.Title: “No major complaints”
Reviews.Author: KeishaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights for the NCAA basketball games in March. The good: - very close to the US Airways Centre - downtown area felt safe with some good restaurants nearby - beautiful view (19th floor) with a great sunrise every morning - close to the airport and very easy to get to - nice clean rooms - friendly staff sort of. The not-so-good: - separate charges for parking and WiFi is a bit much - very small bathroom - poor picture on the tv (analog signal on a digital set?) - very, very small pool that was full of small kids when we tried to use it - "The Terrace" restaurant is open just for breakfast. It should be called "Tables and Chairs in a Large Open Room with Expensive, Mediocre Food" - lots of noise came through the door from the suite next door - room wasn't made up one day Would we stay here again? Yes, if we had something to do downtown and could get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HRGArizona
Reviews.Content: I found a good deal for this hotel on Priceline, was worth every penny. There was only one person at check in but it was mid evening so no issues with check in. They do have self check in kiosks, but as there was no wait I chose to go with real person check in. The rooms were nice sized, very clean and confortable. All staff I encountered were friendly. The restaurant at the top, Compass, was really nice. The food was a little pricey maybe, but tasted good. The staff in the restaurant were friendly and went out of their way to make it a nice experience for myself and my daughter (6 yo). The fact that the restaurant revolves made it that much more interesting. The hotel is convenient to anything downtown of course, but also only a few miles from the airport. The Metro light rail is also close (didn't use it) and could be useful to get some areas, including travel to/from airport. Parking is plentiful, but as with most downtown's in any city you have to pay for parking. Hotel has garage next door with $12 overnight price or $19/day in/out priveleges. Overall this was a nice hotel at a nice price, I can't imagine paying more than $150/night for this hotel... but anything under is worth it. There are other hotels in Phoenix that were $100 per night and the quality is not up to par with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmomwkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for an OAKE convention from 3/14-3/18. Upon arrival it was complete chaos. The lobby was mobbed and the check-in incredibly slow. Anticipating a long check-in I had called an hour before arrival but the phone call was not noted. I only saw 2 people at the desk checking people in. For a hotel this size (693 rooms) and the amount of people for the convention it was extremely understaffed. Although the staff was nice & friendly, the efficiency was nonexistent. Our room was made once during the four day stay. The maid service was so slow that you were lucky if it was cleaned by 4:00pm. The room was stuffy and the thermostat kept turning off and although we had ordered a hypo-allergenic room, I think the only difference is just a loud portable Heppa-filter. The bathroom was very small with only one towel hook next to the shower. The water pressure in the shower and sink was very low. During one of the days they turned the water off completely without warning for 6 hours. The elevators are very slow so add in 10-15 minute wait if you have to get anywhere on time. The only thing I liked about the hotel was the gym which was decently equipped and clean. The location is prime right across from the convention center and a few minute walk to the mall. However the parking is $12, in-&-out parking is $19, Valet is $24 a day. Free meter parking after 5:00 on Friday & weekends. Don't bother with this hotel. I saw that there were Westin, Sheraton & a Marriot near by. Anything would be better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunDeerPark
Reviews.Content: Room was wonderful and location was great. Bought it on Hotwire so very happy with value.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for the location”
Reviews.Author: landcruiserbob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as nice as what you may expect for your money. The lobby is clean and modern. The location is ideal next to the Phoenix Convention Center. The rooms are so-so. Clean, fairly small with small beds that seem a little bit old.Take the glass elevator up to the 21st floor. There is a great view of Chase field and the Phoenix skyline. You can also walk about 2 minutes down the street and watch a live 12 news broadcast on East Van Buren. A walk 5 minutes the other way gets you to Hard Rock Cafe, and US Airways Arena. Chase field is a few more minutes down the road. Shops, bars and restaurants all around you. If you need the location, and don't mind the price, this is an adequate choice. The rec center is pretty good. The pool is small and it was in the shade most of the day. The hot tub was not very clean. Don't come here for the pool/ hot tub. Self-Parking will cost you $12 a day. If you don't need this location, choose a resort up in Scottsdale off of Priceline. You can get nicer than this for the money. But if you need the location, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but”
Reviews.Author: juzwant2play
Reviews.Content: Because the rooms are pricey I think I can be expected to be more critical. The staff was very friendly, the lobby was nice, and the rooms were adequate though the bathrooms were a little small. We stayed on the 20th floor on the east side and had a beautiful view of the sunrise each morning. The swimming pool was actually a three-foot wading pool and the Jacuzzi had not been working for over a week (nor according to the front desk, will it for at least a week longer.) The Jacuzzi was also designed for looks rather than use as it could only could accommodate five people on a crowded bench on one side. The exercise room was nice and well equipped. The Networks restaurant staff was nice, the food good, and it had a large shaded outdoor patio. The hotel had an Einstein Brothers for coffee/breakfast that was well staffed and even with convention crowds; you were able to get your coffee fairly quickly. The concierge was very helpful but we experiences that special instructions did not always seem to get to the tour guides, prices were not always accurate, and one of the restaurants recommended was closed for repairs. The hotel catered to conventions and those visiting for the sports or theater venues, so there was not much beyond that to do in the area. Taxis were readily available to get you take you someplace else though (Scottsdale was a popular destination). The hotel was situated a couple blocks away from CityScape in one direction and Arizona center in the other which provided some entertainment and restuarants. We also enjoyed a pedicab ride that we picked up at the Arizona Center.

Reviews.Title: “More smoke and mirrors than a carnival side show”
Reviews.Author: MarEReynolds
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the staff of this hotel. I recommended them to any and all. I was treated with respect and dignity. This is something that is unfortunately lacking in this day and age of cookie-cutter corporate institutions. I will mention Mr. Sasa Kresevljakovic and Ms Erin the front dest clerk. They are a great credit to the Hyatt Hotel system!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and service makes this place high quality.”
Reviews.Author: HumJer
Reviews.Content: I spent a week working in this location and i believe it is a superior stay. I was impressed by the lobby, the room and cleanliness, and the amazing service. Here is an example of their service: I had brought a durable plastic case for a conference, but had mistakenly left the key behind. The staff at the Hyatt offered to call and price local locksmiths to assist me in opening it. If we weren't able to open it, they found a security guard who was willing to assist me in breaking it. The locksmith was able to get it open thankfully, but I appreciated all of their care. My only criticism was the price of the drinks downstairs... I would recommend trying some of Phoenix's other locales for price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “A top hotel in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Erik S
Reviews.Content: This excellent hotel offers a perfect business location right across the street from the convention center. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. Service is also perfect as well as the different restaurant alternatives within the hotel. Ordering breakfast to our room was a bit expensive but really worth every dollar. Ask for a high level room to enjoy the magnificent views. The taxi service at the main entrance is good as well as the front desk service that do not hesitate to help you with almost everything yuo could need. One drawback is the price of the WiFi service that is unreasonably high when it should be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice/Upscale, slow service”
Reviews.Author: BaronFoer
Reviews.Content: Evrything about this hotel was nice. Rooms and workout room are ok akthough rooms are bit smaller than expected. The pool is very small, like a kiddie pool, no laps here. No real views from ther rooms. The lobby is very new looking and big, shame they couldn't put more of it into the rooms. The bar is a good sports bar but pricey. Location is great just across from the Convention Center a couple of blocks from the Baseball stadium and 2 blocks from a catholic Church. Check in was well below average. Front desk was very friendly but it took them forever to check in people about 8-10min per person.....

Reviews.Title: “Should Be Better”
Reviews.Author: dad113056
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in I was greeted by an enthusiastic front desk associate. I thought this is a good sign then the slide downhill began. Shower temps. never got above lukewarm, the porcelain soap dish was badly chipped in 3-4 spots and the coffee maker had NO coffee, cream, sugar ect. ect. I personally went down to the front desk to report these issues and was assured they WOULD be taken care of. 2 days later nothing. Also needs some rehab for dirty/old hallway carpets and odors that might be due to the said carpets. Happy bubbly workers are great but attention to promises and detail is sorely needed. Sorry but from a Platinum member I will look else ware the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Hyatt Regency Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: welyho
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Phoenix for two nights to attend a conference. I had paid extra for the business package. My room was tiny, and the window faced a wall. The linens on the bed were old with large holes. Someone used the ironing board as their dinner table, and it was soaked in chicken grease. The hair dryer only blows cold air. The room's thermostat was set on 69 degrees, and wouldn't change. The walls of my room were so thin, I could hear the person in the next room SNEEZE! The large convention of high school students prevented any guests from sleeping through the night. Each time I got on the elevator, all of the buttons had been pressed.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency - Compass Arizona Grill”
Reviews.Author: keltzar
Reviews.Content: We didn't get to stay in the hotel, but we were on holiday in Phoenix and my wife and I spent our wedding anniversary dinner at the Hyatt. It was more by chance really, we had gone up there for a drink and stayed on through dinner... and we could not have asked for a better way to spend our anniversary. The view was spectacular as it revolved , the food was quite good ... and the service was attentive (though some of the waitresses did not seem to really speak english). I thought I wanted to balance the views of the other poster who seemingly had less of a good time :)

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual Hyatt standards”
Reviews.Author: 2banadventurer
Reviews.Content: Rooms are noisy. Bathrooms are so small that they are almost non-functional. You definitely can't have two people in at the same time. The door barely clears the toilet. I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mflan46
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect if you are going to any downtown venue, however for the price and considering it is a Hyatt brand, I did not find the accommodations to be of a 5 star quality. The check-in process was very smooth and the staff were very helpful. I was actually upgraded as I am a platinum member, however the room was not substantial, the bed was a bit uncomfortable and there were no added benefits or services that I usually get at a hotel in this price range (free water, club lounge, etc). The fitness room was a bit small, and could have used a little upkeep on the equipment, however it had everything that you need. No major complaints, except that the price was a 5 star price, and the hotel was more of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A leetle less than one would hope”
Reviews.Author: trripman
Reviews.Content: This is after all a Hyatt Regency- which I think of as one of the better Hyatt brands. Still, it's more or less an average business hotel with the usual flaws you see when things aren't being run punctiliously. As usual these tend to be trivial but you wouldn't (probably wouldn't) see them at a Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton. The toilets in the lobby were, um, apparently not being well cleaned when I was there. Not to be obsessed with this but the toilet in the room was unstable on it's moorings. The bed sagged. As I said,nothing earth shattering but adjust your expectations. BTW the appetizers at the bar during happy hour were not bad at all. The check in people were exceptionally helpful and friendly- I am starting to think that Hyatt gets this right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: quebec80
Reviews.Content: I loved the easy check-in system. With a swipe of my credit card at the front desk kiosk, I was able to check-in quickly and easily. My room was very clean. The bed was comfortable and had plenty of pillows! The staff was incredibly friendly and very responsive to any request. The hotel was well-situated for the convention center (my reason for choosing this hotel) and within easy walking distance of several restaurants. The pool seems small compared to the size of the hotel, but since I stayed here in February, I did not use the hotel pool. The fitness center was great. My iPhone plugged right into the treadmill, so I could easily listen to music or watch t.v. right on my treadmill. My only real complaint about this Hyatt was the $13 charge for the Internet. For the prince of the room, I felt the extra $13 was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Older and average”
Reviews.Author: KristyLH
Reviews.Content: Rooms were average and old. Shampoos soap conditioners are stinky- bring your own. The service was good when we asked for things they were prompt about bringing and fixing our non-draining tub. They are charging way too much based on what you get at this old rundown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShaunEdm
Reviews.Content: Perfectly placed hotel downtown Phoenix. The service was great as we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite. The room was HUGE and larger than most people's condos. The amenities were aplenty in the bathroom with full soap bars and high quality shampoos. Very clean throughout with a great view of Scottsdale. The hotel being in the downtown area lends to a dull night life if there are no sports games going on. Better to choose Scottsdale for your hotel needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: BellaBenoni
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Phoenix in February, and besides the beautiful weather, I really enjoyed the amenities and food choices at this hotel. Each day, at our meetings, the lunch provided by the hotel was fresh, somewhat healthy (compared to other hotels I've stayed at for meetings), and well presented. They offered cute little desserts as well, such as a pumpkin creme brulee that was amazing! The meeting rooms themselves were fine...nothing spectacular though. They sort of crammed too many of us into a room the first day, but once we split into our break-out groups, it was much better. They provided the basic snacks and drinks, but I really appreciated that they had soda available first thing in the morning. So many places only offer soda after first break, so this was a nice surprise for those of us that take our caffeine cold. I did not get to try the revolving restaurant at the top of the hotel, since our groups went out to dinner each night, but I can only imagine that the view from the 24th floor is awesome. I ate in the bar (off the lobby) for lunch and had drinks there also a couple of the nights. The food in there was pretty good, and they offered sushi, as well as a couple of great salads. The rooms were fine. My bed was a little saggy, but I still slept like a rock. The fan was adjustable, so I could turn it up louder and not worry about hallway noise. The window was actually the whole wall, so the view was great. I was only on the 7th floor, so the view wasn't perfect, but I could see the pool and a courtyard area, so that was nice. They had what seemed like a million elevators, and they traveled at warp speed. That was such a pleasant surprise. I rarely had to wait at all for one, and even when I did, it was only a minute, at the most. I wish all hotels had that many elevators! The hotel treated our group well, and I imagine that if we decide to meet in Phoenix again, that the Hyatt will be on the short list for potential hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Lesley41
Reviews.Content: I arrived a bit early because we had business meetings in the hotel, and was quite impressed with the technology used to check in. I only had to swipe my credit card, and they knew who I was, and the computer told me my room was not ready, but that I could input my phone number and they would text me when it was ready, which they did. There was a live person standing there to help, so for those of you who may be turned off by the process I don't think it will be a problem. When I was texted that my room was ready, all I had to do was go back to the computer, swipe my card, choose a couple of options on the screen, and my room keys popped right out. Probably the worst thing about my stay was when I entered my room there was a latex glove on the floor which was kind of creepy. I used toilet paper to pick it up and flush it, and basically forgot about it after that. The room was clean and comfortable, so no complaints there, but it was really a basic room for the price, although I think all of the rooms in that vicinity are pricey. The hotel provided food for the business meetings that we had, and I do have to say I was not impressed with that, but the regular hotel food in the restaurants may have been good. I also found the prices for drinks in the lounge to be excessive. A regular domestic bottle of beer cost $5. I recommend going to the establishment across the street, as the same beer was $2 during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhxDoctor
Reviews.Content: The staff is very professional and competent. The rooms are well appointed and some, facing out, have stunning nighttime views. Very romantic evening possible in this setting.

Reviews.Title: “Vast improvements make it a good bet”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: This place has been renovated nicely. The lobby is now quite nice and the rooms are in good shape with a fresh look. Staff was pretty helpful and check in/out was speedy. It's not up to Hyatt Regency standards in my opinion, but then it's a city hotel, not a resort. Expect a cool, chain feeling a step above your suburban Hilton, witch full service hotel prices for everything for water to breakfast. But the place looks good, has. Nice pool area, and is close to everything downtown (which for tourists is probably not much you care about). Worth a stay if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Next..........”
Reviews.Author: Grh2012
Reviews.Content: Stay in Hyatts all the time. My three nights were three nights to many. From the check in to the check out, the room, and the places to eat were below average. There was no customer service or attention to detail. The showers lacked water pressure and didnt get hot no matter what time you took a shower.The buffet was awful, the restaraunt at the top was overpriced and the meal was not up to par. When we asked the front desk for directions to Mesa airport he told us to google it and when we asked the valet he didnt know directions. If you have two airports guests come from I would imagine having printed directions to hand out would be helpful. A very disappointing stay and if we have a meeting again in phoenix I will be staying somewhere else. Save yourself from aggravation and stay at a better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Think of somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: CapeCouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this past week (Jan. 20, 2012) while attending a conference and choose the Hyatt because of it's location right across from the Convention Center. When we checked in we were told they could not honor our request for a king size bed, but they would put us on a high floor so we would have a better view. OK, I can live with the two queens. We go to the room and open the drapes to see our view...More hotel highrises and an oblique view of some mountains. Went back to the front desk and got moved to the opposite side of the hotel on the same floor. Better. But the room itself wasn't anything to write home about. Small bathroom, with no room to turn around, torn shower curtin. The main room had 2 queen beds, a small dresser, a night stand between the beds, a desk, desk chair, and some lamps. Notice anything missing? There is no chair except the desk chair, (which is fine for the desk, but not as the only place to sit for four days. What hotel doesn't supply a chair for their guest? The linens were old and the towels were frayed and pretty much everything looked old and worn out. If Hyatt wants to be a destination hotel, they have to improve their image. Simply beacuse they are the closest hotel to a major venue doesn't mean we won't go elsewhere for better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Breakfast Buffett to Start the New Year With!”
Reviews.Author: GREENCHILEcam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on New Year's Eve. The front desk saw that I am Platinum Hyatt Member and gave me a higher floor room with a fantastic view of the East Valley!! There were plenty of parties around the hotel but I did not indulge. Stayed in my room watching movies and surfing the free internet (as Platinum member). The breakfast buffet was very good! I wanted to eat again but I was full. Attentive staff bring your drinks to you, even though they don' t have to because they come with the buffett. I charged it to my room and went back to bed. Gotta have more energy for 2012! Parking was an issue because I did not want to pay $20 per night. I found a spot across the street and kept it all night. No parking fees on holidays and weekends. Can't wait to come back to this fine hotel!! (Swimming Pool is outside and unheated.)

Reviews.Title: “If you must stay downtown, this is a comfortable choice”
Reviews.Author: grapesucker
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not a fan of urban hotels, but this one does a pretty good job of creating a resort type feel. The roof top pool is adequate for catching some sun (sun hides behind the tall buildings at around 3:45pm, at least in January. When I think of Phoenix I think hiking. Of course there are no trails in close proximity to the hotel, but the concierge recommended a 6 mile route in the city that extended into some historic residential areas and through a couple of urban parks. Very nice. The route is laid out on a handy map u can fit in your pocket. The beds and pillows were fine for a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Only average hotel in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: 7Eileen
Reviews.Content: Overpriced hotel in a good location-close to mass transit, cultural events. No microwave, refrigerator or in room safe. Small coffee maker in bathroom and toiletries were good. No airport shuttle and no free wi-fi in the room either. Staff was helpful and efficient. Room was clean, spacious and modern. The Grill restaurant was OK, and the breakfast buffet was fantastic, as were the servers. The Compass Room was open for limited hours. The business area and printer for ease of airport boarding pass printing was useful but expected for this level of hotel. Then there's the cost of parking: $9 to $12. a day. Would not stay here again as there are many other hotels to choose from in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: banb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week to attend a conference at a great rate. Convenient location near public transit, restaurants, shopping, venues. Approx. $20 for taxi from airport, no shuttle service. Car rental on sight. Staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge staff were very helpful as I regularly had questions about sights and recommendations. Room was spacious, clean, comfortable and modern. I appreciated the ihome dock. It was too cold to enjoy the outdoor pool. The revolving restaurant had great food and excellent view. Unfortunately, it was only open for dinner so the view was limited at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: txvig
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in town for the Arizona Marathon. The hotel was very conveniently located - one block from the Convention Center Expo and two blocks from the starting line. The self serve parking garage is conveniently located across the street and was reasonably priced - $19 per day. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The hotel staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful and really made the stay nice. You don't mind paying a little extra when the staff is this committed to helping you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel with great revolving restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Gemma1977
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night en route to San Diego. Nice enough business-style hotel in downtown with great access to sports arenas and convention centre. Room and bathroom standard. Took three attempts to get a working iron, but otherwise no problems. Loved the self service check in/out booths. What was excellent was the revolving restaurant. Had good food (huge portions though!) with truly excellent service. Sadly after 16 nights in 7 hotels on honeymoon have forgotten the waitress' name - but she made our dinner really special.

Reviews.Title: “So-so.”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Nied
Reviews.Content: Internet gouging! Internet is $12.50 per device, per day (forget about bringing your Ipad if you have to bring your laptop). $6.00 bottles of water are placed in the rooms. 1-cup-maker cheap-cheap-bad coffee in the rooms. Room movie rental is $18. The buffet breakfast is a 5 out of 10 --- very blaseh average, with an extra side of grease. There's no upside to this hotel- nothing is horrible (except the internet gouging), but nothing great stands out either. Not a good value for the $$.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: dsparis1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with four other couples stayed at the Hyatt Regency on New Years Eve. We were able to all get on the same floor near each other and since our room was the largest on the corner of the building, it became the party room. We enjoyed some time out at the pool & jacuzzi and met later on for a happy hour in our room before dinner out. The service was great and everyone was very helpful. Also, the hotel is in a great location for restaurants, theatre, night clubs, etc. Everyone had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency_ Compass Arizona Grill”
Reviews.Author: Fair_reviewer_NC
Reviews.Content: This is a review of a Hyatt's Regency rooftop revolving restaurant - COMPASS ARIZONA GRILL. The restaurant opens @ 5.30 pm. We were seated rather promptly by a table at the window with a view of the downtown's numerous skyscrapers occupied mostly by bank institutions. If you came to Phoenix downtown in hopes of browsing small shops like other ordinary city, you won't find ANY in Phoenix but you will find plenty in Scottsdale 15 minute away ( by car). To turn around once, takes approximately an hour; during which we were served our meals. Please DO NOT mistake all the awards proudly displayed on the walls for ZAGATS -they are not - and very likely for a good reason. The bread you get is nothing fancy, a regular corn bread. My order of eggplant bisque tasted nothing like eggplant but rather like a heated generous scoop of lightly seasoned heavy cream. My party ordered a mushroom flat bread with goat cheese which tasted quite interesting ( in a good way, we like to explore). For the main course I ordered a grilled salmon with asparagus. All tasted fine but only thanks to all the butter my food flooded in and was clearly added to make up for LACK OF FLAVOR. My party ordered the special- a medium steak with scallops. The steak arrived medium rare with seared scallops the size of a track tire - again no seasoning besides butter whatsoever. We found out the price ($ 50.00) only when the bill arrived. The most odd food of the evening was my side order of RISOTTO???? - a breaded and deep fried cake Of some odd mix of rice and Mac cheese? - which was promptly sent back.... The salmon was $32.00, the bisque and flat bread about additional $25.00, glass of wine and one bottle of still water. Interestingly we were charged 2 x $5 because we were party of 2 regardless that my companion never even touched the glass. Despite visiting from NC I do understand that water in Arizona is scarce and perhaps pricey, still imagine a large table of some 12 folks sharing few bottles of wine and everyone paying for water even if only the driver was drinking it????? The staff was courteous but for the price -about $160 including gratuity I would expect a little more. We are foodies willing to pay the price, but unfortunately the food in Compass Arizona Grill is way to overpriced even for the view of the city and did not live up to our expectations, for better lack of words.

Reviews.Title: “Not great ... but good!”
Reviews.Author: Horseintown
Reviews.Content: We just spent the last two nights of 2011 in Phoenix. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel. Our room was on the 21st floor, nice view. The lobby is modern and nice, very pleasant first impression. Elevators were not enough for the people traffic going up and down. Employees were constantly diverting "elevator traffic" traffic to service elevators. Not a big deal for us. Corridors where a little "worn out". The room with outdated popcorn ceiling was small but pleasant. There was no fridge, but what bothered me the most was the towels. They were rough and worn out, not a pleasant thing to wrap yourself into. The allover experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff hampered by lackluster building, added fees”
Reviews.Author: 94Q45T
Reviews.Content: Generally, nicer hotels have great staffs well trained to make their guests stay pleasant. In this case, the staff came across more like family (the good kind) happy to have me. From cleaning crew to front desk, I have never experienced such a friendly bunch of folks. They all seemed very happy in their work. The downside is that the design of the building is sterile and unappealing (to me, anyway). This was an usually cold week in Phoenix (below freezing at night and low 50's day). The hotel common areas never seemed to warm up. In the room, I had the thermostat set for 74, while at home it's usually set for 68 at night. The room was spacious and well appointed. I could do morning exercises with no problem. There were plenty of convenient outlets for charging devices without having to unplug lamps or move furniture. There was a nice fitness center with variety of weight machines, free weights, bands and cardio. It was a couple of machines short of being complete, but better than most. The hotel also offers in room support fro exercise with channels devoted to it on the TV. The location is very convenient to performing arts and sports venues as well at to the large convention center. The train from the airport stops one long block away, and there is a self park garage across the street (valet service is available). There is a nice bar and an Einstein's Bagels on property. The second floor restaurant really is more of an open air eating area devoid of atmosphere. It features a decent but unremarkable breakfast buffet for $15.95 which includes coffee and juice. That's a much more reasonable price than at other Hyatts I've tried. The fees will kill you. I like higher floors, but this is the only time I've been charged extra for that that ($5/night), and I was not informed of the extra cost. The view was awful since there are several tall buildings nearby, and the practice is a good reason to choose another chain. Internet is $15.95. That's becoming more common, so frequent travelers will be better off with the USB cellular data modem from their carrier. The bed was great, the room quiet, and the shower uncommonly good. Housekeeping was very effective and seemed to learn my habits and preferences ( stayed several nights). There are some other restaurants within walking distance. I didn't see any upscale ones, but also did not walk around much due to the weather. Steve's across the street is short on atmosphere, but friendly folks, free internet and really good food (try the ostrich burger). If there are no events downtown, this is a dead area. When there are events, it's pretty crowded and parking can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if your business takes you downtown”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to imagine a more convenient location if you are visiting the Phoenix Convention Center. Situated directly across the street, the Hyatt is a very safe bet. The property is a bit old and beginning to show its age but holding up very well. The nights I stayed were sold out and I did not hear another guest while inside my clean and comfortable room. We dined in the revolving restaurant one night and were quite impressed. the lobby bar and grill offered a nice, more casual setting as well. Service was impeccable. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel! Lots to do and see within a short walk!”
Reviews.Author: Dustin H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at Hyatt Regency Phoenix in November 2011, after not having stayed there in a few years..... This hotel is beautiful- they did an excellent job with the $15m spent on the December 2009 rennovation! There are a variety of great restaurants within the hotel (including sushi in the bar!), but the best part is this hotel's proximity to the new downtown attractions. Believe me, downtown Phoenix is not the same as it was just 5 years ago. A short walk from the side door of the lobby will put you at Phoenix's new 'CityScape' entertainment area that is full of shops, restaurants, and entertainment. Or walk just steps out the front door and see the newly expanded, renovated Phoenix Convention Center or Arizona Center! Might not be the newest hotel in Phoenix, but certainly one of the best in quality, service, and value!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Four_Ball
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Phoenix was a nice choice during out stay in downtown Phoenix. It is conveniently located, adjacent to the convention center and athletic complexes. We took advantage of the light rail to get to Tempe and other areas - a very nice benefit. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. The sportsbar in the lobby is a great place to catch an evening drink or meal. The rooms were not spacious, but very clean and well-decorated. The outdoor pool was small, but in a downtown setting was probably about what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Ivan30501
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are nice and the bed is very comfortable. I was there for a comference and did not have personal transportation but this hotel is located in the center of everything. The glass elevators provide a great view of the city. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful all the time. I really enjoyed staying there for a whole week!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: threecedars
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, comfortable lobby with Southwestern decor, excellent and friendly service, and extremely convenient to the convention center, sporting arenas, restaurants and everything downtown. Gorgeous views of the valley from the upper floors and super fast elevators. Einstein Brothers Bagels is located right off the lobby, which was nice for a quick breakfast. The front desk has an excellent map of downtown that lists nearby restaurants and important buildings. Networks Bar and Grill is a nice place for a nightcap or late snack. The only thing I didn't like was the toiletries. They had a medicinal scent, so would recommend bringing your own. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “FREE INTERNET NOT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bullet54
Reviews.Content: There was only one thing that was not perfect...Internet was Almost $13 per day Are we in the Stone Ages? All the restaurants outside the hotel had free internet but not the Hyatt? We stayed for a week and the stay was lovely, TV was awesome, pool was perfect, fitness room has state of the art machines and lots of towels and unlimited water. Loved the toiletries and the nice thick bath towels...the view from the upper floors is incredible...would stay there again for sure...close to everything downtown. Just have to walk a block to get some internet that is everywhere except the Hyatt. :)

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it...”
Reviews.Author: trvlrOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Well appointed and modern. I ordered room service twice during my stay and loved it...very unusual to get such great food and service when ordering at a hotel. This one is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Plush located downtown close to everything”
Reviews.Author: BaronFoer
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed with excellent sleeping beds. good restaraunt but at Hotel prices. Workout room is outstanding and it has a pool. Location os what's it's all about at a normal price for Hyatt. several mexican restaraunts in the vicinity along with a small mall with theaters and places to eat. catholic church right around the corner. Overall not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomad1957
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Hyatt Regency Scottsdale. Great room Great pool, except water slide was not open Great staff except for, not so great valet service, very slow!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: reviews1phxaz
Reviews.Content: THis hotel is a great chouce is traveling to downtown Phoenix. Everything is within walking distance. Our room was nicely decorated and had a huge balconey, not much of a view but huge. The self parking was 12 a night and valet is 18. I would stay again for the right price. I did Pricelines name your own price and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days in October. I was attending an event and the convention center and this hotel's location is perfect. I stayed in a king bed room on the 8th floor. I had a view of the mountains. The room was very nice, what you should expect for convention hotel prices. The weather in Phoenix this time of year was perfect. The concierge lined us up with a great golf outing, and the price was very reasonable. I enjoyed dining at the various establishments downtown. The downtown ambassadors are very helpful. The light rail is nearby and can connect you to many other opportunities, which may be welcome to anyone staying downtown. The Phoenix convention center is the best facility of its type I've used.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for a convention”
Reviews.Author: danacaryindc
Reviews.Content: There is absoultely nothing to do in downtown Phoenix except go to a convention. This is great convention hotel because the service and rooms are excellent. It also has a nice work out facility and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msp2phl
Reviews.Content: Great location if your in downtown Phoenix. The hotel is directly across the street from the convention center and with in walking distance of Chase Field and USAirways Center. The hotel check in process was easy and friendly.The rooms were well appointed and clean. The king size bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a little on the small size for the size of the room. The biggest con for the hotel was the internet fee. You'll pay a service fee for each device that needs wireless, for the price of the room internet service should be included especially since this is a convention center hotel. The view from the 24th floor resturant was fantastic; the food was just ok. If your company is paying stay here, if your footing the bill I am sure there are other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for convention attendees”
Reviews.Author: 2dman
Reviews.Content: I was attending the IFMA show in the convention center and stayed here for 2 nights. Overall this is a fine hotel for conventions and its location directly across the street is a plus, particularly if you are carrying items. A big plus is that they don't have a fee for accepting packages sent to them in advance for exhibiting at the shows. I had a few hiccups in checking in. First, I am not too fond of their terminals at the check-in counter; they are confusing and the people behind them end up helping you anyway. I had booked an upgraded corner king suite with balcony, as I had anticipated my wife coming along and thought she would enjoy the view and sun. Plus, I like a room with lots of light. Unfortunately when I got to the room I discovered several things; first, it was a handicap room, which I hate. My feeling is that at this price in particular I should have been notified; I definitely will ask at hotels in the future. Second, this was not a corner and looked out onto a sitting area at the same level. This was a problem because there was basically a sidewalk outside my window, so anyone waling by could look into the room. This meant that I had to keep my curtains closed constantly, which made the room tomb-like. See my photo below of my view of Phoenix. In addition, the walls transmitted noise from the room next door, apparently being used as a meeting area for some convention people. The room itself was large and fairly well appointed with a large flat TV. the bed was very comfortable; the work desk was fine. A minus was that there was no minibar. By the way, there is no bar at the hotel pool either. The tap water tasted unusually bad, to the point that I didn't want to drink it or make coffee with it. They must realize that, as they had 2 bottles available in the room, but charged over 5 bucks each; forget it, I bought some at the store below. On the plus side, the entire staff was very upbeat and helpful. The facility was modern and clean. I think in general visitors will find the rooms to be fine. The surrounding area was clean and safe, but at night the area is dead. The selection of restaurants is fairly small. People seemed to linger at the Networks lounge on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “It looks nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: jjtmcd
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference last week. Location was great, right across the street from the convention center but at $275 a night I expect more. The staff was really quite good, pleasant and professional. High marks for them. And room darkening curtains rocked! You could sleep thru the day if you weren't careful. The bad was the price for internet, irks me to have to pay on top of the room fee when a cheap hotel gives it for free. The food from room service was consistently bad. The wall paper in the bath had some odd staining and the TV had a bad signal with diagonal lines on nearly every channel. Nice that they provide two bottles of water in the room until you see that they'll charge you $5 if you actually drink them.

Reviews.Title: “Pay DOUBLE for internet; $$$ parking; all price, no perks”
Reviews.Author: Eric V
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and nicely designed hotel. But for what you pay, you get very little value beyond pretty decor. The stingers are internet and parking. INTERNET: You'll pay $12.40 per 24 hours for EACH DEVICE. I logged into the hotel's wi-fi on my laptop and my phone. That meant two internet service charges each night: Almost $50 for a 2-night stay! I think it's ridiculous these days to have to pay for internet at my hotel. Cheap hotels don't charge for it -- why should a premium hotel? And they ding you again if you want to use wireless on your phone? PARKING: You have 3 options. Valet parking at the hotel is $27 a day! Self-park in the garage next-door is $12 per exit. So if you aren't planning to go anywhere once you park, that's what you'll pay. But if you even make one excursion, you're up to $24. Alternately, they'll sell you an unlimited in/out pass for $19 a day, but it has to be for every day of your stay. Park on the street? Not really an option. Phoenix meters charge up to 8PM on weekends, are $1.50 an hour, 2 hours max and only take coins. In the end, I paid more than $100 for parking and internet for a 2-night stay, arriving late Saturday and leaving Monday. Beyond that, the rooms are small, have no mini-fridge or mini-bar, no robes, the beds are OK but nothing special -- basically none of the things you'd expect as "premiums" for a premium hotel. So like I said -- the decor is very pretty. And the room was very clean. And you're in downtown Phoenix. And all added up, doesn't justify what you pay. Come hang out in the lobby, then go stay somewhere else where you get a better value for what you pay. Hyatt, you need to step up your game.

Reviews.Title: “It's what you would expect from a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: europe_tvlr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt recently for a conference. We were upgraded to a corner room with mountain views, which was quite nice. The room had a king bed, sitting area with a couch and chairs and a large flat screen tv. Internet was included in the price; however the connection was quite slow and at times non-existent. The location is great, near the stadium, conference center, shopping and restaurants. The bottom line is...it's a nice hotel with all the things you would expect from a chain hotel. If you can get a reasonable price, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: enskatar
Reviews.Content: In September 2011 I spent 11 nights in this hotel. There's not much to see in downtown Phoenix, but you can get easily to Mill Avenue and Scottsdale and other good places by light rail or by bus. The hotel itself is great - clean rooms, large LCD tv, couple of good restaurants... If I ever visit Phoenix again, I will choose this hotel again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: sfairborne2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt last week for a conference at US Airways Center in downtown Phoenix. It was still HOT at 103, but the hotel had a welcoming water-mist system as you entered the lobby. It was a nice touch and really helped to cool things down. The staff were courteous and helpful, providing plenty of information about the area and where the good places were to eat. When we changed rooms (for bigger beds, not because anything was wrong with our first room), the staff were more than accomodating, and moved us to a new room (upgrade) for no extra charge, AND sent a valet to help us move our luggage. It really made a difference. The rooms were a little smaller than we are used to, and decorated in a contemporary style. The decor reminded me of Santa Fe, with bold southwest colors. The only vanity was located in the bathroom, so if it was occupied, the wife's makeup had to wait. The beds were terrifically comfortable, and I wish I could have slept in them longer! The hotel was very clean, and the restaurant we ate at (Network?) was tasty and reasonable. Overall a very pleasant stay, and I would recommend it due to the ammenities and experience. Location was convenient to the Center and Chase Field (Diamondbacks), and all points that I was interested in. I guess that's why it was worth paying a little more than what I usually do.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the new Phoenix Westin”
Reviews.Author: oahulady66
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and am starting to provide reviews so others know the great and not-so-great. I would call this place "incredibly average". I don't think I stay at the nicest places, but I will admit I'm getting so I expect some things that I call basic... like a towel rack, enough hangers, and a safe. Am I asking too much? Pros: - Very nice check in and concierge and operator... very nice people - Quick and easy change to get a late check-out an hour after normal time - Great downtown location - Comfortable bed and pillows - Plug on bedside lamp (this is very nice) and 2 plugs on lamp on table (If you think this obsession with plugs is weird, try staying in a room where it's hard to find a single one and then you'll realize how many things you need to plug in (esp if you're working there for several hours) - Ginger-scented Hyatt bathroom amenities smell nice (I'm reaching for compliments here) Cons: - 50 mins room service, at 4:00 pm (!!), for one caesar salad and one bottle of water - Room service salad was incredibly average - TV has an HDMI input but the "input" button on the TV doesn't actually work, so the input is moot - TV remote is so worn, only the number "5" can be seen - TV doesn't swivel all the way to be seen on the bed, and there is only one small armchair otherwise - Bathroom is tiny. Has NO towel racks at all... just ONE hook. One? - Not enough hangers in the closet - No drawers, only open shelves - No refrigerator or mini bar (I usually empty it, get my own sodas as I don't drink coffee, and get milk for morning cereal to try to counter the "fat traveler effect"... no luck on this trip) - No in-room safe - Desk is too small to comfortably fit a laptop and a room service tray - Tub shower (vs. a nice tiled "walkin" shower)... - A lot of activity on my floor - people in and out all night. It was if they put everyone on one floor to make all their work easier. Not great for noise although not too disturbing (just odd). More: - I didn't try internet as I have an aircard - Colleagues said fitness room is nice but I walked instead, so can't verify I recently stayed at the new Phoenix Westin and it was DIVINE!! Standard room came with a couch, chairs, huge desk, empty refrigerator, lots of coffee, huge foyer, huge bathroom, walk-in shower you could switch between "rain" and "regular", great TV with HDMI input, etc. Tons of public sitting areas to have a business chat as well. I would HIGHLY recommend it over this worn Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overall service isnt where it ought to be”
Reviews.Author: dannysherwood
Reviews.Content: A great modern hotel not too far from the airport and downtown services. Great sized rooms, clean and tidy, modern finishes and a great reception area. Staff were very friendly and helpful. But would i stay here again? No. The biggets niggle for me was no free wi-fi, and a charge of $12.50 for it per device that you logged onto. Utter joke. So for 2 iPads and a phone it was nearly $40 of wi-fi charges for 24 hours, when queried reception said thats what it is, you have used it so you need to pay. In my opinion if a small chain-free hotel can manage to offer it for free then so should a huge chain like Hyatt. And ive stayed in other Hyatts where it it is free. Id never stay here again on this alone. Add to that a chareg for late checkout of half a days room rate at $90 for asking for a 2 hour extention to latest check out time again seems a tad harsh. The hotel wasnt that busy so it isnt like they needed the room there and then. A small fee id accept but half a days rate is again a bit of a joke. In summary a great hotel room wise and decor wise in a good downtown location, friendly staff but with rip off wi-fi charges and other odd policies id avoid this place and go elswhere. There is a Westin next door and other hotels arpund which would probably be better value all in all

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Phoenix hotels”
Reviews.Author: BruValM
Reviews.Content: I am a weekly business traveler and frequently travel to Phoenix. I have stayed in many Phoenix hotels and really enjoy the Hyatt. Service here is excellent and very attentive. The hotel is clean and well-maintained. The downtown location is ideal. I stayed here in July and August 2011 and will return in September. Breakfast buffet and service are excellent and food at the hotel bar/grill is also good. This hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - very nice”
Reviews.Author: sleepsox
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while in Phoenix. Rooms were spacious and well decorated. The hotel is situated nicely down town. Walked to Chase Field for a ball game. Parking was extra but not expensive. The gym was excellent. Lots of equipment and 24 hour use. Very nice! Pool was private and clean. Loved the Einston Bros. deli on the main floor. Great for a quick bite to eat. Only issue was that WIFI is extra fee. Highly recommended place. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service & large comfy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiej36
Reviews.Content: The customer service was exceptional at the hotel, in particular from Erin at reception. She was sensational and an example of what customer service should be! My entire experience at this hotel was great. As a priceline customer i was expecting to be given a room & not have an option, I got to choose where in hotel I would like to be & after requesting a king high room I was given a massive room on the top floor of hotel w/ amazing views! Was very happy they didn't discriminate how I booked and I had a great stay. Room was very clean, lots of amenities and housekeeping were very fast! Only problem was having to pay for Internet in the room & again downstairs if u wanted to print, turns out there is a computer to print boarding passes which I didn't see till I had paid to use computer in business centre. Ate at sports grill networks & my veggie burger & fries were great & value for money if u don't want to leave hotel. Directions from staff were clear & accurate, they know the area well. Would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend to people.

Reviews.Title: “For Conventions, This Place Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: Step across the street to enter the convention center! Can't beat it in the heat of Phoenix! If the restaurants are too expensive for you, step out the side entrance and cross the street to enjoy a $7 full breakfast with eggs, meat and potatoes at Steve's Grill. Hotel is clean and very nice. Pool is great for relaxing, but the jacuzzi jets did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Good Center City Location”
Reviews.Author: SheriBobLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: Close to the ball parks. I was able to go to a pre season suns game. Everything in the down town is within walkinb distance. Easy drive to Frank Lloyd Wrights house, and a day trip to Sedona

Reviews.Title: “nicely remodeled rooms, terrible housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Flag1_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while attending a baseball game. I read the hotel was recently remodeled and was interested. The last time we stayed here the rooms needed an overhaul. PROS: valet and bellmen were quite nice. Ryan (bellman) went above and beyond when we hit a snag with receiving the wrong room. He called the front desk, had us switched, moved us to the correct room, went down and retrieved the new keys for us. Very nice, especially since I am somewhat handicapped. CONS: we had two queen beds but only one chair (desk). We opted NOT to have room service since one of us would not have a place to sit and eat. Really...just 1 chair? Not even an ottoman or comfortable chair. Bathroom is very small. Can sit on the toilet and brush your teeth at the same time. I don't remember them being this small. May be another reason we stopped staying. Well, you already know the front desk error now on to housekeeping. We arrive and immediately notice our room had just a sliver of toilet paper (no extra roll) and 2 decaf coffee pods. We rang housekeeping and asked for more toilet paper and regular coffee (person did not speak english). Waited for a little while but no one showed up. Left room and when returned noticed 2 rolls of toilet paper but no coffee, gave us more hand towels instead. I travel with extra coffee pods thank goodness. The next day we left and upon returning the room is made up but a dirty towel (left on bed by mistake) is on the carpeting. The next morning we are ready to shower and check out. No washclothes!! Lots of towels but no washclothes. This time we called and an english speaking person answered and we received washclothes within half an hour or so. We are rewards members so found some of the service was a bit lacking. Is housekeeping really this bad with this economy? Someone good must need a job. So, we may be trying the new Sheraton down the block the next time we stay in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: drmary569
Reviews.Content: Right next to the convention center. Nice big hotel. short walk to the Arizona Center. Einstein bagels in the lobby for easy breakfast. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, and value”
Reviews.Author: jpap10
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. My family stayed for one night while passing through to LA, and it met our needs perfectly. Location is right downtown near convention center and ballpark. The young lady who checked us in was quite helpful and courteous. The room was clean. The public spaces were clean and well-decorated. Parking is free downtown from 8 p.m. to 8 a.m., and there are PLENTY of spaces available very close to hotel. We parked right outside the side door. This might be different if the baseball team is in town. The pool is kind of small, but not bad at all. Internet is NOT FREE. I find it hard to believe that anyone pays for internet. Hyatt should provide this as a free service. Overall, a great night.

Reviews.Title: “Would not give this hotel 3.5 stars! (Maybe 1 star!!!)”
Reviews.Author: MeInWonderland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 3.5 star hotel yet it is a far cry from anything close to a 3.5 It feels like the hotel across the street the San Carlos (a two star) offers more than this 3.5 star. The bed was very comfortable - but that was the only nice part of this entire stay. However, unfortunately the hotel was not able to accomodate my husband's and my need to for a single king bed. Instead we had to sleep in two seperate beds. The parking is a pain! It would be much more convenient if it was not so expensive! ($20 for two nights we spent $40 in just parking fees!) And, it's quite a bit of money for internet. We paid $12. This really is a shame, considering just a cross the street that 2 star hotel offers free internet and much cheaper parking. I guess you need to pay more money for the free features of a two star at a 3.5 star hotel. Very frustrating!

Reviews.Title: “All good, except...”
Reviews.Author: NashDasher
Reviews.Content: This is a great downtown property. As a general rule, reviews on Hyatts need not be filled with the usual rhetoric about cleanliness, bed comfort, and decor. Hyatt gets all that and they always have. This property is no different. Rooms, beds, location, staff, ad infinitum is all good at this property. An excellent downtown property. My only reservation, thus only a four-star rating, is that I believe that charging for internet service is like branding a hotel as archaic and primitive. The internet is no longer a novelty. Now, it's a necessity. It is available free of charge nearly everywhere, from airports to coffee shops to my own personal phone. The assumption is that inside the confines of my hotel room, I'm a captive audience and therefore I demand internet service. That of course is preposterous. Internet service is simply a necessity that expect to be there, ready and waiting. Like hot water. It's just part of the package. That Hyatt still charges a premium for it brands them, in my opinion, as a chain that sees the internet as a luxury. It is not. It is a requirement. Thus, in my travel planning, Hyatt never enjoys premier status.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: gatekeeper667
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a mini staycation in downtown Phoenix and concert at the Comerica with my boyfriend. Best thing we could have done! I got a great rate on Priceline and thought it would be adequate. Boy was I surprised! Awesome location to all the venues downtown!!! Service was great, everyone was really friendly. Rooms were quite roomy and clean. Typical Hyatt rooms, nothing to write home about but very nice. Surprised this is only rated 3 1/2 stars. Make sure you eat at Networks...great food and our server Kristin was one of the best servers I've had! We enjoyed our first night so much we extended it another night even though we only live 10 min away! We will for sure be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but it was the staff who made it so.”
Reviews.Author: LisaMSacramentoCA
Reviews.Content: I attended Comicon here this year over the Memorial Day weekend. The hotel was just across the street from the convention center, so its location is what brought me to the hotel. The lobby is nice and comfy, with a southwestern decor. The giftshop has many fine AZ souvenirs. I didn't go to the Compass restaurant due to its prices, but the Einsteins Bagels was great for drinks and inexpensive salads and wraps. Terrace Cafe had good breakfasts. The Networks Bar and Grill was great for evening meals, with the drinks being especially good. Our first waitress, Valerie, was the best! It must have been good food since I gained 2 pounds even though I walked all over the convention center 4 days straight. I did not use the pool area but my friend did, and said the pool and spa were wonderful, as well as the workout room. The floor carpeting was showing wear, but it must be a busy hotel. There is no free Internet but if you buy food at Networks, we were told we'd get free connection, and there are computers in the lobby to use, 30 minutes for $5, if you must access your email. There is also a computer to use to print out airline boarding passes, a nice convenience. My main gripe with the otherwise adequate rooms was there was no mini fridge, as many hotels are adding now. There was a coffee pot and hairdryer though, both appreciated. Now to the staff: from the man who checked us in (gave us a 19th floor room!) to the engineer who fixed our shower to the desk personnel at the front desk to the wait staff in the Terrace Cafe, all were friendly, helpful and this while maintaining their nerves during a crazy sci fi convention where zombies and other costumes walked the hotel at all hours. I would stay here again if the location warranted. Thank you, Hyatt Hotels, for making our stay so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the convention centre”
Reviews.Author: ChiFT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days attending a conference at the convention centre. It is extremely convenient for the convention centre - just across the street. The hotel itself looks better on the web-site than in reality. All in all, it is pretty comfortable. A few specifics: Location - marvellous for the convention centre, being right across the street. It is in downtown, but Phoenix downtown is not particularly exciting - there isnt really very much there. But arguable, this is a problem with Phoenix, not the hotel. Lobby - definitely looks better in teh web-site than in reality. Breakfast - Food not good and the waiters/waitresses I find a bit blunt, even a bit rude. Smile please, and be a bit more sincere. Room - clean, tidy, well maintained, spacious, well decorated. But there isnt a comfy chair or a coffee table - the only chair in my room was the chair at the work table. Checking the picture on the website, these arent there either. Wifi-wired - apparent, only the lower floors has wired access. Restaurant - the restaurant at the top of the hotel seems very popular - every time I wanted to go there, it is full, so havent managed to eat there. Had dinner once in the sports bar instead. Food OK. Coffee shop - it has a starbuck style coffee shop on the ground floor which is very good, and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL weekend stay--What more could you ask for!?”
Reviews.Author: Row21Middle
Reviews.Content: Purpose: Weekend getaway Length of stay: 2 nights Pros: -Located in the heart of Downtown Phoenix, right across from the Phoenix Convention Center. PERFECT if you're going to the US Airways Center or Chase Field, both of which are literally just at the end of the street. There was also a light rail station within walking distance, which made it easy to get to ASU and the airport. It's also nearby an outdoor shopping mall --the Arizona Center--with plenty of places to eat (i.e. Hooters, a Greek restaurant). However, we stayed here during a weekend when there were no events going on, so the area was dead. Nevertheless, I always felt very safe walking around the area, even late at night. -Lobby had a tasteful desert theme and was warm and inviting -Wonderful glass elevators that overlook downtown Phoenix; this was really something at night! -Room was very big, and the beds were so soft! I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud! -Bathroom had complementary toothpaste--LOVED that, since I had to throw mine out at the airport. -Fitness center was extensive, especially for a predominantly business hotel. -Front desk staff wonderful and accommodating. When I checked-out at 6am on a Monday morning, the female agent (shame I didn't get her name), was so upbeat and genuine. I left with such a positive impression!! Cons: -Didn't like the check-in kiosk--talk about a perfect example of something good in theory, but awful in practice. It created a very cold check-in experience--they really should be scrapped. -TV didn't have HD programming; not a big deal (who goes on vacation to watch TV?), but the channels were very pixely. -Pool wasn't that clean (there were cigarette buds floating in it). Overall: You absolutely can't go wrong with this hotel. Loved it, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: journey63
Reviews.Content: I would just like to commend on the great service I've received at the terrace cafe. Our server was friendly but I can't remember her name, I do want to comment though on the excellent service that we got from Chad. He was very attentive, greeted our table first, brought our drinks and continuously check on us. He was very personable and had a warm smile. Good food, could have had a better selection in music, overall experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place tostay when on business.”
Reviews.Author: whitestanw1
Reviews.Content: Top notch establishment. Treated like royalty upon check-in. Did not have to bother with check-out invoice was placed under my hotel room door early on the day of check-out. Hotel amenities are beyond the norm. Will use hotel again when in that area. Would recommend to anyone traveling to the Phoenix area. Location was a little cluttered but early late evening traffic starts to thin out. Still a geart place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “To Flea or not to Flea?”
Reviews.Author: lori1w
Reviews.Content: We had a long travel from the east coast with our infant son and when we checked into our room we unpacked and got settled in. Shortly after getting ready for bed I spotted a flea on my infant son. At first I thought it was a gnat, but after catching it under a glass cup my husband and I confirmed it was indeed a flea. The front desk agent Chelsea was extremely apologetic and upgraded us to a suite on the same floor and helped us move all of our belongings. The security guard named Heather also helped us with the daunting change of rooms. My son was tired and so were we as it was close to 4am our time. They also took care of our dinner since we had not eaten at all. Also, our breakfast for the stay. They more than made up for the inconvenience and we were very impressed with the help and their kind and empathetic hospitality. We ended up staying despite the initial bad experience since the rest of our stay was pleasant. In fact we extended for one more night and recommend this hotel to our family and friends. Great service and warmth from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MJM7777
Reviews.Content: A real treat to stay here. It is located right by the train, which was so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Fzedlach
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline. I arrived at the hotel and learned that I would have to valet park my car, at a price of $27.00 per night. Ouch. Check-in was fast, and very friendly. I was offered a two-double bed room at check-in, or offered an upgrade to a King Bed with a balcony for $20 more. I upgraded, and it was NOT worth it. The balcony offered a view of - NOTHING! The room itself was clean, with Portico bathroom amenities. The hotel is in a central location, with numerous sporting facilities, restaurants, and a mall nearby. I ate at the restaurant on the 24th floor, which revolves. It was good, but VERY expensive with a limited menu. The views are very neat, though.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: mfartist
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends stayed for two nights and had an excellent time! The hotel has wonderful amenities: a large workout room, swimming pool and hot tub. There is also a nice fountain area separate from the pool to lay out in. The staff at breakfast was friendly and the food delicious! The top floor fine dining restaurant, The Compass, has incredible views of the city...but mediocre food for the prices. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hyatt hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazilu25
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency Phoenix is right next to the convention center. A quick trip to and from the airport, friendly staff, outdoor pool. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great staff”
Reviews.Author: neimanmarxist
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a deal on priceline the day before we arrived. Prior to our arrival I called with our preferences- upper floor, nonsmoking room, king bed. Even though we were priceline customers and some hotels treat you worse we got everything we asked for. The rooms were lovely- see attached photos- big, soft bed and large television, sitting area, marble sinks in the bathroom, and those nice amenities they offer at Hyatt that smell like lemon verbena or something. The hotel was very quiet . I happened to go to the fitness center the next morning. It's really great. Tons of excellent, new equipment. I didn't try the pool, it looked nice though, and there is a hot tub by it. The staff at this friend really goes out of their way to help you. Kyle at the restaurant downstairs, which was not bad, was very nice. Also when we showed up the valet informed us that we could just park for free around the corner. Check in and check out staff were also very friendly and efficient. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Hurry up, we have money to make here.”
Reviews.Author: mercinary
Reviews.Content: Parking - was "full" except for the 1.5 floors of reserved and valet parking. Valet $27/day - plus tip Self Parking $19 (w/ in and out) - if available, basically if they can't sell the parking to anyone else for more money. This option obviously makes them the least amount of money as they make it very inconvenient to purchase this. Short term $12 - 1 time trip. When I arrived the parking lot was closed to self-parking mainly because they sold out their guests to accomodate the NBA game, then capitalized on the apparent full lot to make the additional $8-15 extra. Check-in: The "what can I do to assist you" is a complete front. I was "directed" to the kiosk to check in, and while I was asking questions about the parking and hotel, the employee was pushing buttons on the kiosk. I had to insist she stop and answer my questions. I had confirmed my reservation for 2 Queen beds over 2 weeks previous. They had me in a King-sized bed. I had 4 people in my party. I was offered a free roll-out bed. When I asked where the other person was supposed to sleep. She informed me it was not her job to assign sleeping arrangements in my room. "Just this time" she could get me 2 beds. Two full sized beds that is..... Needless to say our 2 night stay in 2 full beds....not that comfortable. Don't worry it will be "just this time" , because I won't be back. Otherwise the hotel was average, nothing too bad, nothing too exciting. As mentioned before, the nickel and dime game gets real old. Join the now, free wireless is in most of the cut-rate hotels and this place still charges for it. By the way, walk out the Adams St. entrance and you can get it for free from the restaurant across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location in City Center with aesthetic appeal. Otherwise, average at best.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinToothDoc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency while attending a dental convention. Since it was my first visit to Phoenix, and I invariably stay at a Hyatt property on business, I was looking forward to my stay here. The hotel's main prize is its proximity to just about anything you could want downtown. The Convention center was directly across the street, and with major venues like Chase Field, US Airways, and a slew of fine and casual dining restaurants within a few blocks walk, it was ideally situated for your needs downtown. It was obvious that the hotel went to great lengths to showcase the esthetic appeal, for the lobby was grand, spacious, and tastefully decorated with high-end items, waterfalls, and elevators opened to the surrounding street and mountains in the distance. That being said, this was the most expensive Hyatt I have stayed at to date, by miles, and even with a group "discount" for convention-goers. The rooms were massive, especially the bathrooms, and, again, tastefully done. But it felt like there were hardly enough furnishings to make a dent in the amount of wasted space. The beds were very comfortable and the sleep quality great, but would be expected even given a less expensive room. The absence of an in-room safe for valuable personal effects was a curious omission, and quite notable given the high room rate. Internet access was wireless, in-room, and for a fee, but there was a business upgrade that allowed you internet access, one free breakfast item (buffet or off the menu item) and one shirt/dress press for $25 per day extra, which more than paid for itself if you utilized these services individually. A Wall Street Journal was delivered to the room daily. Menu selections in the couple of dining areas on site had good variety, and the hotel featured a festive bar and grill on premises with high quality food, and good selection, although last call for drinks and food was 11PM, making it somewhat inconvenient for patrons coming back from an event and wanting to unwind, and spend money at the hotel. Again, being a Hyatt Gold Passport member for years, and always preferring a Hyatt property where available, I would have to rate this aesthetically pleasing for sure, but lacking in a few critical areas that you'd expect a luxury chain hotel to excel in. There are other hotels that with the same great location that I might just try next time....

Reviews.Title: “The Additional Charges Were A Turn Off”
Reviews.Author: KarenCOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The room was elegant and our view of the city and mountains was great. The bed was superb and we slept great. This hotel is located across from a convention centre and is close to the rental car agencies and the airport. The pool area was nice but the pool is only 3 ft deep which is fine to cool off but not good for doing any real swimming.
