What makes this hotel less attractive is the additional charge for internet access. A hotel of this calibre that doesn't offer free internet? The self parking rate was OK but then to charge $7 more per day for in and out privileges? I guess they don't want to attract guests who want to explore the city... The icing on the cake was the dollar a phone call charge. This was a really nice place but the additional charges really make it unattractive,

Reviews.Title: “A tired Hyatt Hotel”
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this Hotel in downtown Phoenix, even if the front office team was nice, the Hotel is tired you have the feeling to experience a revival of the 80's with tired bedrooms, my room had stains on the carpet, bathroom door (by the way the bathroom are out dated), no fee wifi... and a restaurant (revolving one) with no good food and finally a limited choice, my crabcakes were cold, the salad a shame. I highlighted this facts to the team who did react on nice manner but by the policies, but with no empathy. I was expecting something else from Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, decent hotel, nothing exciting for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: SirTravelALot12
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel. We had a corner king on the top floor, room 2139, which would be great if we were handicapped. This great room was compeltely designed to be wheelchair accesible and didn't have a bathtub, although it had a large wheel-in shower. I called hte front desk and they had us in another corner king room in about an hour, and it had a bathtub!! Rooms were very clean, at $260/night you would think they could include WiFi, isn't that a standard now days? I paid approx. $60 for 3 days... Valet service was good, and this hotel is very close to US Airways center, very handy to get to the game. The street noise is very audible even on the 21st floor, bring earplugs if you are looking for a quiet night's sleep (horn honking, Church Bells EVERY HOUR!, fighting... to name a few noises)

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect, but....”
Reviews.Author: Ashevillelyn
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Hyatt Regency Phoenix for a conference. Check-in by Erin was wonderful! She is definately an asset to the Hyatt team. My guestroom was very clean, spacious, included all the ammenities that I need for a business trip. An Einstein's bagel shop in the lobby was a plus as well. My only complaint is that I had a FEd Ex package delivered and it arrived at 10:00 am. I went to the front desk to retrieve it and was told it would be awhile before they could go through all the deliveries. I waited, waited, and waited. In fact, by the time they got through the packages (3 hours later!!!) the meeting that I needed the package for had come and gone. What was on track to be a fantastic stay turned extremely frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “war eagle”
Reviews.Author: lverton
Reviews.Content: was there for the bcs game and the hotel was full. staff were great from the front desk to the breakfast buffett to sports bar. not much to do in the immediate area that i found but had my on group. great location for business sleep quality not tops because of noise from open center and full of football fans

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Excellent Service, Don't Pass Up”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvec
Reviews.Content: I was only in town for one night, but it was a very pleasant experience at the Hyatt. As soon as I walked in I was greeted with excellent service. The front desk clerks were extremely friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The amenities in the bathroom included the basic shampoo, conditioner, soap and even a travel sized toothpaste (colgate). The room was setup great for business travelers, as there was a desk to work from and a single chair w/ ottoman and a tall table next to it. Internet was a little expensive at $12/day. But we had a conference rate of like $124. Great location downtown and very short walking distance to the Arena.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: MDavisTucson_AZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Phoenix Nov 27 to attend a concert at US Airways Arena. This hotel is in the perfect location for the Convention Center, US Airways Arena, Chase Field (baseball) and the symphony and opera. We were able to check in early and the front desk personnel were pleasant and accomodating. We had a smoking room on the third floor and there was a sliding glass door that opened onto the pool area and work-out room. I am a non smoker and they had a special air cleaner in the room that really takes care of any smoky odors. My husband still smoked outside since the patio was there. I really liked the room itself, very spacious, king bed, nice linens, large bathroom with large fluffy towels. The hotel in general is very clean and comfortably decorated. Although we did not use it, I saw they had a small business center and Enterprise car rental desk in the lobby near the gift shop as well as an Einstein Bagel coffee shop if you need something quick early in the AM. The service in Networks bar/grill is excellent (thanks Drew) and they have a nice selection of beers on tap. The breakfast buffet has a great selection of fruit, cereals, eggs and the usual fare, but all very freshly made. I stayed here a few years ago for a convention and remembered it to be just as nice this time around. I highly recommend you stay here if your travels bring you to the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to give 5 stars, but just couldn't”
Reviews.Author: jahkelley
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for going to the opera. I was in my room and out of my heels within 5 minutes of leaving Symphony Hall. The room was large, well-appointed, and comfortable. And the service was outstanding. The impression I got from the moment I arrived was that they wanted this to be the first of many enjoyable visits. I had booked my room through Priceline, and was willing to accept less than the best accomodations for the bargain price. But the front desk clerk offered to put me in a different room than the usual Priceline room (a king instead of 2 doubles) since they weren't busy. The guests next door were pretty noisy, and I could hear all their conversations clearly in my room. It really wasn't a big deal. As I was getting ready for bed, they were discussing where to go out. And the next time I heard them was when they were coming home 10 minutes before I had to get up in the morning. The clerk who checked me out apologized and suggested requesting a non-adjoining room the next time I stay. I wasn't sure what the parking policy and rates were until I left the garage. The hotel's website said one thing, the attendant said something different, and the desk clerk suggested parking on the street or I'd be charged every time I left the garage. This sounds like a negative review. But overall, I was very pleased with the location, room, and service. I will stay here again when I'm staying overnight after opera. And I will bring workout clothes so I can make use of the large exercise facility.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to a conference....stay here!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishShmanny
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel with a great choice of bars and places to eat to fit everyone's budget. Staff were great, very friendly and helpful. Bar food was good value as was the bagel bar. The pool area was nice and clean and the sun terrace was great to escape to at lunch time...would definitely go back......Make sure you visit the little shopping are in the Arizona Centre - there's a great Greek restaurant there .....lovely atmosphere in the whole area....Internet is free if you join as an executive member so you may as well join as that's free too!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, lovely rooms, and immaculately clean”
Reviews.Author: BandENorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: In town for a mega-convention (6000 nurses!) at the Convention Center which was just across the street from the Hyatt. When we arrived the front desk staff walked out from behind the counter (like they really wanted to meet us!) and beckoned us to their stations. They rearranged our rooms to our liking (several times!), were very patient and helpful in all our dealings. We had beautifully-appointed rooms, which were immaculate and maintained this way throughout our nearly week-long stay. Things to note: be sure to visit the Gift Shop on site. Along with the usual hotel gift shop items we found great jewelry, scarves, and gifts. First night's dinner at the Compass Restaurant and it was delicious and service attentive and friendly. Also visit Network bar/restaurant for drinks. Great staff there. The guys at the curb were so friendly and helpful! How does the Hyatt do it? The staff were AMAZING the entire week! Those of us working hard on customer service could use a lesson from this group of folks!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for everything Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: grif858
Reviews.Content: If you want to do anything in Phoenix this is a great hotel to stay at. The property is two blocks away from the metro line, convention centers, and arenas. Staff is very friendly and rooms are fairly large. Just an FYI, if you're going to Phoenix, food is fairly scares after people go home from work. Thankfully the bar attached to the hotel is a decent option.

Reviews.Title: “Completely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Hmmhmmbuzzbuzz
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated, extremely nice, wonderful and relaxing. I checked in late on Friday night and after a nice relaxing (and cheap!) cocktail in the bar, I had no problem falling asleep immediately in the wonderfully decorated bedrooms, the bed was extremely comfortable and the recessed lighting in the room made it easy to get ready in the morning while the other person was still sleeping - always handy! The bathroom was nice and the hotel shampoo (which I usually avoid) smelled delicious and the towels were soft. Nice and friendly desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “I got bed bugs at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mknox5
Reviews.Content: I was less than impressed with this hotel. I tried to use their business center to print a power point presentation but they didn't have power point loaded on the computers even though the front desk said that I would be able to print my presentation. I had to pay $5 just to use the business center to find this out. After about an hour of trying to find a way to print, the front desk finally let me into the elite business center area that did have power point and a printer. Printing something shouldn't take over an hour. Also, my room was on the third floor and my door opened up to an outdoor lounging area that played annoying elevator type music even throughout the evening hours. I was glad that I brought ear plugs. And worst of all, I got bed bugs from this hotel. I started itching once I stayed there and finally determined after returning home and still itching that the bumps I have all over my body were from bed bugs from this hotel. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for a conference”
Reviews.Author: WestwoodTrekker
Reviews.Content: It's right by the convention center; the lobby Bar is great, the restaurant is a bit pricy so I didn't eat there, although I think for a romantic dinner I would have paid it and enjoyed the view, but there are plenty of other eating options nearby. Can't go wrong with a Hyatt Regency!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the only cool thing about Phoenix, and it isn't even that cool”
Reviews.Author: ck390
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt after calling in and being told it was in the heart of downtown and when we found out they had a good military discount. The hotel itself is nice, we were surprised considering the great rate we got, and our room was large and had a great view. Once you step out the front door though, things get freaky. Does no one live in this city? We could walk for 3 blocks at 8 PM and not see a single other person. All the restaurants were closed save for the one in the hotel. We met with a "city ambassador" who told us that we were in the heart of downtown, but there was nothing going on and it was literally one of the strangest experiences of my life.

Reviews.Title: “HOT Trip--Literally”
Reviews.Author: pimptown
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was impeccable!!! Everyone at the hotel, from the time you step out of your car, immediately assists you. The hotel probably needs a bit of an update but overall the rooms were nice and comfy. Do not stay there during a RazorBack Game...the traffic and people jam is not thrilling. The fitness center was the only bad spot within the hotel--it was small and the wait for a machine was LONG!!!! The location is located near a mall on Van Buern St which has a lot of eateries—Try Sam’s!

Reviews.Title: “Great.....”
Reviews.Author: airport_brat
Reviews.Content: This place was great. I arrived for a convention and roomed with a colleague. Everything was great - did not go into workout room, but pool was nice. Roomy rooms and the doors do slam, but I did not hear any other voices/activities from other rooms. I forgot my deodorant, of all things, and didn' t have time to get more before the conference - so they delivered it up to our room. Iron wasn't working well - a brand new one was cheerfully delivered in about 5 minutes. Breakfast in the cafe was a bit pricey so didn't eat there much. Restaurants down the street on Van Buren were great and the Oak Creek shop was good also.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: CCMcC
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is a lovely hotel, but it is built with paper walls and leaden doors. You can hear conversations in the next room like there is no wall between you. And the unbelievably heavy doors simply will not shut unless you slam them. So all day and all night, there is a chorus of slamming doors. Add to this the popping sounds of the windows as they adjust to the Phoenix summer sun, and you have a cacophony of sounds that are sure to leave you exhausted at the end of your visit. I am also growing weary of high-end hotels that charge high prices for tricked-out lobbies but have no value in the room. There is no refrigerator, no safe, and no free internet here. But I do feel compelled to point out that the rooms are large and have very big flat screen TVs. And the beds are amazingly comfortable. The staff are also amazingly friendly and prompt. So if those things are high on your list for a hotel, then this Hyatt will serve you well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: drgreenlee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt as part of a week-long event at the Convention Center. It is directly across the street from Phoenix CC, and within reasonable walking distance of both basketball arena and baseball stadium. Also an easy walk (even with rolling luggage) to light rail connecting to airport. There are also many restaurants and a few clubs very nearby, but no fast-food that I could locate. There is also a supermarket ~1 mile north, an easy walk for me, but not for many. Both parking and internet are expensive. However, free internet is readily available across the street in any part of the CC.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with my Stay.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine315
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site I was skeptical about what was in store at this hotel. I recently spent 10 nights and was very pleasantly surprised. The lobby of the hotel was very nice. The room itself was a typical room for a Hyatt, nothing spectacular but nothing to complain about. It was very clean and housekeeping always did a good job. Every employee of the hotel I encountered was friendly and went out of their way to ask if there was any way they could be of assistance. I did use the exercise room during my stay, it was clean and equippped with all the equipment I would want. The pool was small but I enjoyed the few times I was able to spend there. I did not eat in the restaurants in the hotel but every morning went for a coffee at the small bagel shop in the lobby. There is also a restaurant diectly across the street which serves a good breakfast at a much lower price than the hotel. I also walked a few short blocks to Arizona Center where there are more restaurants. For those who don't want to spend money for the internet in the hotel there is free internet as well as 2 computers to use across the street at the visitors bureau. The purpose of my trip was business but would definitely stay here if I were going to a baseball game at Chase Field or a game at the US Airways arena.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel that needs updating in order to accomodate longer-term clients”
Reviews.Author: purpleknif67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days for NW training in early May 2010. As in many of my earlier posts, I cannot complain that much considering that my room and tax were covered and I was only responsible for incidentals. However, many of my complaints are similar to the ones I expressed in an earlier post relating to the Hyatt in Columbus. 1) Paper-thin walls. I could hear all my neighbor's activities, from screaming babies to various adult activities. If I stay at another Hyatt, I'm bringing ear plugs. 2) The rooms need to be re-designed in order to accommodate longer-term guests who are staying for more than two days. For example, mini-frigs and microwaves need to be placed in rooms, clothing hooks need to be installed in bathrooms and more drawer space needs to be provided. If not, more hangers need to be placed in the room so guests don't have to call down for more. The design of the rooms need to be tweaked so it is more practical for guests. The giant cactus picture, funky water spicket (sp?) and roll door is aesthetically pleasing, but not practical. The bathroom needs to be larger in general. If not, than some type of wooden fixture needs to be placed under the sink so guests can store there toilietries. Safety grips also need to be installed in the shower tub or at least safety strips affixed to the bottom of the tub. The mat is uneffective and in some cases, was dangerous. The pool, exercise room and patio next to the pool were very pleasant. In general, my stay was satisfactory, but I'll hesistate before I stay at another Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: I only stayed 1 night while on a business trip. The location is great as it's located right downtown close to the stadium and many nice restaurants. Upon check in I was greeted by a very friendly front desk staff. The room was clean and comfortable. They charged $12.49 for internet access which I still think should be included in the room rate. I did clock the internet speed at 2Mbps down and 0.7Mbps up. I had banana pancakes for breakfast which were kind of pricey, but really good.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised by our stay.”
Reviews.Author: dmeyers
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews I was a little nervous about how our stay at the Hyatt would go. I traveled with my daughter and 11 mo. old grandson. We had requested a crib in the room and it was there along with a complimentary travel pack of baby soaps. Check in was smooth and the staff was very friendly and polite. Room was nice and clean. Only time we had a problem with the room being hot was when we forgot to close the drapes and were gone for the better part of the afternoon. Bathroom was small but I don't spend alot of time in the bathroom. Pool is small but we were the only one in it both times and it worked great for what we needed. We did take a stroll around the Compass resturant but didn't have a chance to eat there because of company functions. The manager saw us struggling with a tired baby the one night and wanted to know if he could get us anything, some milk or something. He was very pleasant as was all the wait staff. They were always asking if we needed anything special for the baby. When they found out one of the ladies at our table was a vegetarian they offered to get her a different dinner. Not much shopping in the area other than the one mall which was mostly souveigners but check out the Oak Creek store the lady there is a sweetheart and lots of local artist pottery and such. Plus if you purchase $35 or more they will ship it for free. Bought myself a beautiful piece and can't wait for it to arrive. The light rail is easily acessible. Wasn't planning on taking it with luggage and baby but the super shuttle which was really vans didn't want to take us to the hotel as we did not bring the carseat.

Reviews.Title: “Fine convention hotel with the usual nickle and diming tendencies”
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Brown.95
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hyatt for one night with a business colleague. I was told parking was $12 but then got charged $27 for the valet. Rooms were not huge, but fine for a large convention style hotel. The service was marginal. Trying to get our car, the valet wasn't around and we waited almost 20 minutes. Checking out, there were plenty of front desk staff on hand, but none of them seemed interested in helping us. The internet is $13 per night. So my great hotwire deal turned into $30 in nickle and diming upcharges. But if I didn't have a car or need internet, I would have been very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “expensive, dirty- unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveller065
Reviews.Content: on our trip throughout the south states of the usa we had several hotels with a higher standard and much better prices. Every extra we had to pay: Internet access (just across the street were several free access points) - parking (19 USD for parking daily). The breakfast consisting of artificial eggs, burned toast, cold coffee and fatty beacon. Claims the the bed was not changed from the people before and sticky drawer - unfriendly not responsive personnel.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment and a rip off”
Reviews.Author: emb0008
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not worthy of the star ranking or brand name and tried to nickle and dime me to death. 1. Mattress cover (the one under the sheets) was filthy, with dirt and hair on it. 2. Requested new sheets and one of them was either dirty or had a very obvious stain on it. 3. Bathroom was small and awkward with the door in the way of the shower and toilet. 4. No towel rack in the shower, and no hook or towel rack for hand towels in the bathroom. I had to hang the hand towel on a hangar in the closet outside the bathroom. 5. Water faucet has a "low water usage" adaptor which is a big nuisance. 6. Back of bathroom door had several pieces of hair stuck on it. 7. Not enough places to set things. 8. Rooms are big, but only 2 beds and a desk chair (a chair without arms). 9. Desk has a metal bar running underneath it which not only obstructs legroom but is easily bumped into with one's knees. 10. Hotel charges $19 a day for parking, $12.29 a day for wireless internet, and no breakfast is included. (Internet fee was waived by Danielle Schaftny in Sales after I called and complained about it before arrival.) 11. Wireless internet requires guests to give name and room number to a 3rd party website in order to access internet. 12. Water bottles in room have tags saying $5.25 will be billed to room if you open them (yeah it's one of those hotels). 13. When I needed to use the business center to print out a 2 page document, the woman at the front desk wanted to charge me $25 for access to the business center (which is actually only 2 computers and a printer for the whole hotel). 14. The downtown location is only good if you have to be there for a conference at the convention center or plan to go to the US Airways center, because it is otherwise dead at night. Better to stay in Tempe or Scottsdale where there is some nightlife. In summary, this hotel pales in comparison to much lower-priced hotels such as Marriott Residence Inn and Hyatt Place which offer free internet, parking, breakfast, free use of computers/business center, sofas and lounge chairs, and kitchens. This hotel is pretty much stuck in the 1980s as far as their pricing and revenue scheme goes. If you want to be nickled and dimed to death, stay here. If you want included conveniences and no hassles, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large hotel, clean and convenient in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: I see some mixed reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor, which surprises me. I have stayed in this hotel a number of times (always through Priceline or some other service) and I find it quite consistent. It's a cookie-cutter Hyatt, with a wonderful bed, comfortable clean rooms and some great dining choices around the area. It's right in the Copper Square area of Phoenix, an area about three or four blocks square that has arts and entertainment. Like many cities, downtown Phoenix hasn't had much going for years, but it is currently going through a renaissance. I like this hotel, we always had good service there, and there's a great bagel place right in the lobby level for a decent breakfast. Another more expensive option in the same area is the Sheraton, which has a great bar called The District with good music live on the weekends, but I'd still stay at the less expensive Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering if you need to be in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for three nights while attending a series of meetings at the Phoenix Convention Center. It’s a very nice property that has been kept up well over the 30+ years of its existence. Having grown up in Phoenix, I watched this hotel being built. It was quite the sensation with its eight-story open-air lobby and revolving restaurant on top. Three decades hence, it’s still a very nice hotel. Obviously, the hotel has been refurbished (probably several times) since its construction so room amenities are strictly 21st century: comfortable beds with multiple pillows and high thread-count linens, flat screen TV, work stations with Internet access (both wired and wireless), iron and ironing board, iHome radio/iPod dock, higher-end amenities in the bathrooms, and bathrobes available upon request. Owing to its late-70s vintage, however, the standard rooms are a bit on the small side. The air conditioning, while a step up from the wall-mounted units popular in so many hotels, is still noisier than it ought to be. And the soundproofing leaves something to be desired; several times, I heard fellow guests in adjoining rooms or out in the hall. Further, I will never understand why upscale hotels like the Hyatt Regency use thin, cheap-feeling towels and then – worse – let them get so worn that they develop spots so thin you can see through them. The first morning, my bath towel had a couple of large thin spots as well as a noticeable stain. The bath mat I used on two out of three mornings had begun to fall apart and had numerous loose threads hanging from them. Generally, though, the property continues to impress. The revolving restaurant on the 24th floor, the Compass, offers great views of Phoenix and some pretty good food and drink as well. If you’re acrophobic, the Terrace Café on the second floor atrium level or the Networks Bar and Grill on the ground floor are more casual but still pretty good, though without the views. There are several shops, including an Einstein’s Bagels, off the lobby and a car rental counter on site. The hotel also offers a pool, fitness center, and business center. Downtown Phoenix, though, is a downtown that has never quite found its feet. Certainly, the Convention Center, U.S. Airways Center, and Chase Field draw crowds for specific events, but when there’s nothing special happening, the area gets pretty barren, save for the area’s homeless. But if you’re going to Phoenix for a meeting or event downtown, definitely consider the Hyatt Regency. If you want to take in a view of the city, The Compass provides that for the cost of a drink, even if you’re staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BurghGirl71
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband to a show at the convention center. His company gave us a choice of hotels so we stayed at the Hyatt for my convenience in reaching day time venues while he was working - the others were too far away from the light rail. They did allow us to check in early the day of our arrival which was a big bonus. The room was merely average - desert generic decor, but sort of a dated look. Linens so-so. Limited TV channel selection. Pay plan for wireless internet access- it was $12-14 a day which is an outrage when it is free at the Holiday Inn Express. Not very fast either. Housekeeping skipped our room the first day because she saw me enter the room but did not see me leave a few minutes later. She apparently paid no attention to the fact that there was no Do Not Disturb hanger. I had to call late in the day to get the room cleaned and then they didn't leave face cloths or provide an extra roll of TP. Took 3 calls to get it all right. Having said that, the staff was always responsive and polite (I was polite when I called.) Limited "amenities" included a very weak hair dryer. Shampoo and hand soaps were provided and a very stinky hand lotion. The "fragrances" were awful. No tissues were provided. (really, Hyatt?) Iron and Ironing board in closet along with one extra blanket. Laundry service was available which we used because we were extending our trip. I have no idea if prices are in line or not -first time i have ever used such a service. $7 to launder a pair of jeans. The items were returned the same day around 530 pm and my jeans never looked so good. Day 1, I heard very loud construction-type noises all morning in rooms above and beside us. When I left to go to a museum I discovered a young man on the floor by the elevators cutting the carpeting. When I returned some hours later (apparently he was at it all day,) he was gluing the seams. The rest of the day and all night into the next day, our floor reeked of that overwhelmingly horrible chemical smell of glue. No warnings were given to the guests on that score so that is bad. They obviously didn't care who was breathing those fumes. Are we hotel customers supposed to be huffers? Noise continued day 2. The concierge employees were most helpful and friendly. Gave us good directions to the light rail, the closest drugstore and restaurants and when they found out upon our check out where we headed next, gave us some small publications and a map. Nice touch. FOOD: The restaurants were OK-not great. Didn't get to try Compass as it was closed for a private party. Their breakfast is held in a separate small space on the 2nd or 3rd floor that quickly crowds. Buffet offered was $14.95 and limited selections. No vegan entrees on the buffet which was shocking at such a hotel. Come on. Vegetarian fare consisted of eggs-scrambled only. Oatmeal was on the buffet and the only fruit offered was cantaloupe and honey dew. Again. Come on. The only thing good was the coffee. Food was not kept hot enough on the buffet which is a food safety issue. It doesn't take a long time to produce a bad outcome with eggs. There is an Einsteins' Bagel for breakfast and lunch which is better priced. A 2 to 5 minute walk about the neighborhood shows you that there are much better and cheaper places to eat. Lots of places are open for breakfast. For dinner walk a couple blocks north to the Sheraton and eat at District, or walk south and eat at Kincaid's. For entrees, I preferred District and my husband Kincaid's. The portions at Kincaid's prevented dessert. At District get the whoopie pies and "milkshake." We both LOVED those. There are bunches of restaurants all over the area. AREA: a couple blocks from the Hyatt and Convention Center was the Arizona Center which is small outdoor shopping "mall" with mostly restaurants and cheesy gift shops. Some store fronts are closed. It is a tourist or convention-goers trap. There is no drug store nearby - you have to take the light rail. I followed concierge directions with no trouble. It is basically an honor system. You pay $1.75 a ride no matter where you are going. $3.50 gets you all day. No one checks to see that you have a ticket which I find very odd. There are no turnstiles or ticket readers per DC Metro. You 'activate" the ticket but no one checks it. The CVS is the closest to the Hyatt-they said about a mile but it sure seemed further than that. It was right by the rail line but the sidewalks and everything around were run down, littered and dirty with graffiti on the sidewalk and nefarious characters hanging about. I have no idea whether it is safe or not but it sure didn't seem to be. Perhaps the hotel personnel should find out? SUMMARY: My impression is that the Hyatt Regency management feels they have a captive and well-heeled business clientele from the Convention Center who are on expense accounts and therefore, don't care that the Hyatt is pretentious and overpriced and offer few amenities. Overall, a real bare bones, a la carte hotel. You get only the value of the location and everything else is overpriced for its quality - or lack of same. The management and housekeeping should try to emulate the concierge staff. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: 1julieg
Reviews.Content: I've not been one to stay in a Hyatt because I normally find the Hyatt reservation fee a bit high for my budget. Because I had a colleague share a room with me and by getting a AAA discount, I was willing to splurge this time. Let me just say, I really enjoyed my stay. I immediately signed up as a Gold Passport Member to reap benefits. Now that I've tried a Hyatt, I am very interested in staying in one again. I loved all it had to offer! I enjoyed the gym, comfy beds, late check out and delicious breakfast. I like the fact I didn't have to worry about the room being clean and if I'd had to deal with noisy neighbors. The Hyatt is first-class in my opinion and I'm willing to "splurge" again for another good night stay. The only negatives are that parking was a little expensive and the bathroom toilet is not separate from the counter sink and shower stall.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT LOCATION--PRICEY---BEWARE OF THE ELEVATORS”
Reviews.Author: PATHRCO7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this Hyatt for more than 20 years. We work a trade show in Phoenix every February and the location of this hotel combined with the rate we get with the trade show makes it an easy decision to stay here. It appears that they recently updated/remodeled portions of the hotel, including the room that I stayed in and the check-in area. Some parts of the hotel are still pretty dingy for "Hyatt" standards but all-in-all, this is a pretty nice place. It can be VERY pricey for food & drinks. I received free internet as part of our trade show booking but I completely agree that charging for internet is bush league in this day & age. If we didn't get the rate with our trade show, this is one very expensive hotel for room rates. It is exceptionally convenient to access the baseball & basketball arena's, some great restaurants and a lot of cool bars. A MAJOR caveat at the hotel is during peak times when groups of people are going to or coming back in from the convention center or sporting events------for some reason, they have (5) elevators and you NEVER see more than 2 or 3 of them working at the same time! This has been a problem at this hotel for as long as I can remember!! There are times during the day that it will take you 8-12 minutes to get on an elevator. All the while, 2 or 3 elevators remain idle. I don't get it and I've run out of oxygen complaining about this problem over & over & over again. Networks is a great bar and they have significant patio seating. Again, this is a pricey place but if you want to be smack dab in the middle of downtown Phoenix, the Hyatt Regency is a great choice. The beds are REALLY comfortable and the rooms could use some more lighting. My climate control worked perfectly but some of our guys that stayed in non-remodeled rooms had some aggravating problems with the A/C not working or shutting off for no apparent reason. The staff here seems very, very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Charging extra for internet is so third-world”
Reviews.Author: Chilkoot_Hiker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, all the luxuries you would expect from Hyatt. Had to pay for parking which I guess is to be expected downtown in a big city. But it really frosts me to have to pay $12+ for 24 hours of internet access. Come on, Hyatt, if every dinky motel and rv park out in the boondocks can offer free internet, what's your problem? Here's a tip: one block away is a Paradise Bakery Cafe. They have free internet, good food, and cookies to die for. Spend your money there instead of paying the Hyatt for something that a "luxury" hotel should be embarrassed to charge extra for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, pricey internet”
Reviews.Author: Mitre10
Reviews.Content: My hotel room here was nice, clean, and comfortable. The service staff were incredibly nice and helpful--every single person who I encountered. I write this for every hotel where I have to pay for internet, but I consider it absolutely inappropriate to charge for internet. I have stayed in $40 hotels with free internet...obviously in the middle of nowhere, but it is just not $13 to provide someone with 24 hours of internet. So even though I really liked the hotel, next time I will find a place with free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarrMel84
Reviews.Content: I am just returning from Phoenix... My stay at the Hyatt was great. Since I was out on business, I was able to walk around the city a little during the first night. The hotel is beautiful... I stayed on the 20th Floor... Service was great... I even had dinner at The Compass on the 24th floor. It is an elegant hotel that rotates... Very nice... Food was excellent. Bedrooms very nice... Comfortable beds as well. As far as the internet connection... There is a fee, but if you have your own air card, it's free of charge. I carry my air card everywhere and I was able to log on in the hotel w/ it. The location was great... It sits 2 blocks up from the US Airways Arena (Phx. Suns arena), directly across the street from the Convention Ctr and also a Theatre. Around the corner are small restaurants, shops and an AMC movie theatre. My grandmother flew out w/ me and she was able to enjoy the weather and walk around downtown by herself... The price was very reasonable... I would return to this hotel the next time I visit Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “It's not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Ram001
Reviews.Content: Because of the LOCATION I booked 3 nights at Hyatt. Originally I booked a $199/night -"Conventions Deal" (if I have to pay for the breakfast and internet it will end up for $241.97 + tax $29 = $270 +/night for a Conventional DEAL). Luckily, I modified my reservation after I found the AAA Business Plan for $174/night and it came with 2 free breakfast ($14.99/pp) and free internet ($12.99/day). But for some reason the front desk checked me in with the ORIGNAL higher rate. So be careful at check in because they don't print out the register card and also they don't confirm the rate with you. Once you leave the front desk and it will take a 1/2 hour (at least) to fix the rate. Front desk told me the hotel was recently remolded, but they left a very DIRTY pop corn ceiling. If you don't turn on more than 2 lights on, the room looks ok. Comfort bed without fitted sheet. No safe in the room, so I did not use the pool or gym. I don't feel comfortable to leave my jewelries and wallet in the room. One of our colleagues' room did not get room service for 2 consecutive days, and they got twice unfriendly apology. Breakfast is ok, and if you have "Gerri" - a big Latino lady to serve your table. She might ignore you, or provide with a very cold and unwelcome service. But she wills definitely bring you a bill, so you can "tip" her. The 3rd morning we got a different waitress; after she took our Breakfast coupons and politely said "you all set." without giving us the bill! I was so surprised that I did not get the bill, so I have to walk to her and tip/thank her. When I got home I also noticed an extra surprise charged on my AMEX for $11.38. So I called their local # and they transferred me to their Accounting Dept. it rang for 15 minutes and no one answered. I e-mail them at qualityphxrp@hyatt.com on Oct 27.09 and did get any answer as 11.03.09.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: usgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference in Mid Sept, nice room on 16th floor, Platinum member so I had free Internet. Pool is sort of small and mainly people like to lounge around and stand in it etc so cant do laps easily. Work out roomis small bur well equipped. Room had comfy king bed , desk, and sort of chaise chair with otoman comfy for tv watching. Unfortunatly there is not much to do outside the hotel apart from the convention center, their food places close at 2pm in the afternoon, there is a bar grill across from hotel and a Wyndham close by but no convenience stores or anything like that

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Downtown Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: accidental_squirrel
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights at the Hyatt in downtown Phoenix. Although it's not a high end luxury hotel, this was probably the most pleasant stay that I have had this year (approximately 100 nights at about fifteen different hotels). This Hyatt has been renovated and most things look new. It is clean, my room was quiet, and the bed was comfortable. The rooms seemed a little larger than most other hotels and we had a nice view of the mountains. I asked about internet access and was given a code for free access. The location is close to all the things downtown such as the convention center and the two sports arenas. I was very impressed with the staff, especially the young lady and the check in desk. I was traveling with my spouse (who has a different last name). We checked in on Sunday and stopped by the desk on Friday night to ask a question and Grace remembered both our names in addition to being very pleasant and helpful. The Hyatt wasn't perfect in that the flat screen tv was still standard definition and some of the cardio machines in the fitness center did not work correctly. However, all things considered, it was close enough.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: rickcasi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we wanted to go to a ballgame ..The location is good for that but our room never got below 78....Yes we know it is Phoenix in July...But the rooms were average and parking was 27.00 dollars a night...They finally moved us to another room and even got us breakfast....We usally don`t eat breakfast so I would have rather had free parking.....Trouble is downtown Phoenix is lacking for reasonable hotels, and they know it ..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mditcbitw
Reviews.Content: Ya know, I wish I could have gotten the chance to stay in this hotel before writing this review; however, I just wanted to let you in on th horrible customer service provided by this hotel. I had booked my stay 3 months ago, due to a conference I have there at the end of July. So...I received a confirmation 26 Apr. I just got a call today from the Hyatt stating that they had overbooked & that I was no longer able to stay there. They appologized & put me up in a different hotel & offered to provide transporation to the conference (which happens to be right next to the Hyatt)....yeah, transporation, to include a bus!! I am just completely floored! So, how come they claimed availability when I booked but now all of a sudden they have no availability. [--]!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly biased since I had a touch of VIP treatment”
Reviews.Author: ACoolJeweledMoon
Reviews.Content: I am no great fan of Hyatt, but this was a business trip for a conference so it worked. And due to the nature of the business trip I think I received a slight bit of VIP treatment so I can't complain. I was booked into a very nice and spacious end room on the 17th floor with a huge window and a great view. It had a nice entrance way with a three doored mirrored closet in a dressing area so no complaints there. It also had a nice size sitting area with a comfortable sofa and chair. The room was spotless and stayed very clean the whole six days I was there. Check-in was a breeze, and the front desk person was genuinely helpful. Upon arrival in my room, a staff person delivered a small fruit plate, water, and ice to my room, and I was also hand delivered a package that was waiting on me. I ate in the Networks Cafe a few times, and both meals were very good and reasonably priced, and the service was fine considering they were busy both times. The gift shop had a very varied selection, and staff people were friendly there as well. And at a meeting I attended, three managers made a thank you presentation to us which I thought was a nice touch. My only complaint was my bed was rather uncomfortable. It had noticable sags which surprised me. Based on another Hyatt review of mine, this one was 100% better, but still just a basic downtown hotel chain. If you are going to be at the convention center though, this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: thewildboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for three nights. Thankfully our rooms were being paid for by a family member! We had booked king bed rooms but got rooms with two double beds. We were told no king rooms were available, even though we had booked them and even checked in early. The room was clean and spacious but extremely plain. The beds, although there were two, were very comfortable. Our view from the 16th floor was nice enough. The hotel pool was OK but only 3 feet deep all around. The hot tub was adequate. There is no free parking - the charge to self-park in a neighboring garage was $16/day! There was no free internet access available in the lobby - only for a charge. The only cheap place to get food was the bagel store in the lobby, which was fine for breakfast. We avoided Networks bar but did have breakfast at the Terrace Cafe one morning. The food was very good but it was an expensive breakfast (again I'm glad we weren't paying!). One big plus was a large and modern fitness center with four treadmills, three ellipticals, and four stationary bikes in addition to various weights and other equipment. Some of the equipment was not in top working order but there was plenty to go around regardless. Overall - Everything was "nice" or "comfortable" but for $300/night I would expect something really special. The constant nickel-and-diming of paid parking, internet, breakfast, etc really bugs when you are already paying so much. I recommend staying outside town at a more economical hotel with free amenities and saving your money for restaurants and sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “STAY WELL CLEAR OF THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: jondavi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a convention May 2009. From the deplorable Catering Department,which we needed to place a sign in the lobby notifying customers of our hospitality suite, to the outrageous catering prices for in room coffee service,this hotel has to rate amongst the worst of my business travel experiences. The only notable positive was the great assistance the bellmen provided in moving our numerous pieces of diplay items from the car to the room. Front desk management needs to go back to Hotel School for lessons in assisting guests. If you need to be by the convention center, check out other hotels. The Hyatt Group has sunk to a new level of inferior service. Do yourself a favor and stay well clear of this ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service for only $309 a night!”
Reviews.Author: bluehousefive
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the Hyatt, the clerk assigned us Room 603. If you check the floor map, you will see that 6 rooms on each floor are located in the corners of the hotel, and these 6 rooms are half the size of other rooms on those floors, with a twelve inch window and a view of the brick wall comprising the other corner of the hotel. The hotel was nowhere near capacity, so I have no idea why they would put anyone in these rooms. After checking in, we stopped at Networks for a quick bite and some drinks. The mojitos that they advertise as a special were awful, and I love mojitos. That could be because the service people all seemed to be drunk. One waitress tripped on a step and rolled around on the floor laughing. Our waiter kept bumping into our table, chair, and drinks. The pizza tasted like one of the microwave versions, and the four coconut shrimp for $10 were not worth the money. It was $50 down the toilet, and it convinced us not to have dinner at the Compass Room upstairs. The next day, the front desk gave us a room on the 17th floor, at my request. The view was spectacular, but the room was very small, and missing the decorative touches (throw pillows, blanket, arm chair) of the first room. The only mirror was over the sink in the bathroom, which makes it very difficult for someone to get ready while their spouse is in the shower. There was no full length mirror. That night, I was not feeling well, so against our better judgement, be ventured up to the Compass Room for a snack. My husband had the bisque, which was smokey and good. We had a couple of drinks and the trio custard, and they were fine. The decor left a lot to be desired, but I guess the view was meant to carry the restaurant. Unfortunately, we went back down to Networks for March Madness. I had a martini since it was 'Tini Tuesday and they were $2 off. When the bill came, the drink was not discounted. The bartender said the special was only for 4-6 and 11-2. The sign was right in front of us, and it said nothing of the sort. Instead of taking off the lousy two bucks, the bartender argued with my husband and was very rude. This hotel soured us on both Hyatt and Phoenix. If it weren't for the lovely meals and service at Sens and Sam's Cafe, we would not return to Phoenix for another conference or convention. We had already booked a Hyatt in Bonita Spring, Florida for next week, but I am going to try to change that reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency Phoneix - Typical Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailorgirlmn
Reviews.Content: We used points for a one-night stay at the Hyatt Phoenix over Valentine's Day Weekend and the weekend of the All-Star Game! I was actually amazed to be able to get a room given all that was going on. Check In was fast and friendly and we were given a room on the 18th floor. We walked past the diners going to the rooftop restaurant for a romantic evening and headed up to our room. Room was large, clean and quiet. We ordered room service which took about 30 minutes to arrive. Unfortunately the order was incorrectly delivered so we had to wait another 20 minutes for a missing club sandwich. Food was fair to poor and I'll blame it on the busy hotel and Valentine's Day rush in the restaurant. The hotel is in the middle of downtown and perfect for a business stay. Overall I would recommend to anyone needing to be in town on business, but I'd recommend eating elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: SparkintheDark
Reviews.Content: I would rate the service from this hotel as above average. My stay was as part of a group reservation that I was in charge of making and the staff were exceedingly helpful from the word go. We had a standard room that was very pleasant with good maid service each day, with the room being straightened each morning around 10:30. Room service was good and the breakfast really nice, if a little on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Standard downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: greatone3800
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline for a bid of $45/night for a Friday and Saturday. This hotel is downtown near the convention center, which is the standard type of hotel I expect to get from priceline in a major city for a weekend. Parking: There's self-parking in the garage next door, valet or street parking. Street parking seems really hard to find, so we opted for the garage. It's $10 with no in/out (paid at the garage) or $16/day with in and out (paid at the hotel). There's also valet for $23/day. Typical prices. One caveat: the USAirways Center is close by. If there is an event going on, parking might be harder than usual and there might be crowds to contend with. We got there as a Suns game was letting out, so traffic was a bit heavier than expected, but no unbearable. Check-in: We checked in around 10 PM on a Friday night. They said they had no non-smoking king rooms available, so the options were a two double beds, two queen beds, or one queen. We opted for the queen. Also, my reservation was booked as two separate reservations (I initially bid for one night on priceline and then decided to extend by one day). The representative noted it and I thought he linked the two reservations, but apparently he did not. On the Saturday when we returned to the room at 4 PM, housekeeping had still not visited because they thought we were checking out. The Room: We actually ended up in two different rooms. The first room at a single queen on the 21st (top) floor. Two big issues with this room. First, the queen bed isn't really a queen bed. It's more like the size of a double and not at all comfortable for two people. Second, the room has two doors that connected to the rooms on either size. The noise traveled through the doors like they weren't even there. You can CLEARLY hear your neighbors conversations as if they were right in your room even if they are talking in normal inside voices. If you get one of these rooms, I recommend switching right away. The second day we stopped at the desk to ask a question about parking and were offered a king room that had become available. Of course, we switched and the room was so much better. No interior doors for noise to travel through and a real bed. Exercise room: Small, but up to date. There's about 10 cardio machines (treadmills, cross trainers and bikes). Each has a built-in TV. They have headphones for use, but I recommend bringing your own as they didn't always have clean ones available. It also has a small weight area. It's a very small room that got crowded really quickly. Maybe because it was right after New Year's and everyone is trying to stick with their resolutions, but I've never seen a hotel exercise room that crowded. I thought it was open 24 hours, but the sign posted said 6 AM to 10 PM. Not sure which one was right. One nice touch: They had a wine cooler with cold,damp towels in it. Great for post workout. Food: We did the breakfast buffet on Sunday for $17.95/person. Well stocked with lots of options. Overall: Standard convention center hotel. For $45/night, I was satisfied with the experience, but I would not pay full price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best View in the City”
Reviews.Author: Cervantez
Reviews.Content: I’d like to think of myself as a pretty romantic guy, my girl and I have a great relationship and we tend to get out a lot. So when something special happens, that’s usually cause for a little day trip. Recently, my girl got a new job that she was long over due for, she had been under a lot of stress about it but the deal was finally sealed. We still had to play it smart with our money until her new job started, so an in-town vacation was in order. I surprised her by taking her to one of the nicer hotels in one the nicer hotel chains in town…The Hyatt Regency. A beautiful hotel to say the least! Located in awesome downtown Phoenix, the Hyatt Regency might have the perfect location in the area. If you’re staying there, you’ll have access to the local mall whose restaurants stay open late, some really trendy night spots and the theater. You can’t beat the location, but personally, I was more impressed with the inside. Check-in was swift and friendly, the only drawback was that I picked a busy night in downtown. The ballet was in town that night and we had no choice but to use the valet parking. A whopping $27.00 charged to the room for valet service! Pretty outrageous, but it made me look like a big shot in front of my girl, so… The elevator to take you to the rooms is glass, and it’s quite a rush to shoot up to your floor while looking out. Two adults riding the elevator dressed in full evening wear at 2AM was quite a sight for the staff at the Hyatt who assured us, “Everyone does it, don’t be shy.” Ride the glass elevator to the top and be treated to the best view in the city from the Compass Restaurant. This is a beautiful revolving restaurant at the very top of the hotel. You can literally see the entire city from there. We didn’t dine there this time since the Hyatt is quite…how do I say this…PROUD, of this restaurant! I believe the lowest priced entrée on the menu was about $20.00! That’s was little out of our price range that night, but definitely next time. Fortunately for us, the maitre’d was cool enough to let us just take a stroll around the restaurant and have a look at the view for a few minutes…totally worth it! The rooms are awesome! The Hyatt had the highest ceiling of any hotel I’ve stayed in. The room was spacious with the floor space of a suite. The bathroom was kind of small, or maybe it just seemed small because the rest was so big. It was also the first hotel I’ve stayed in where the bathroom had toothpaste too, amazing how little things start to count. The bed was huge and covered with comfy pillows. The room itself was a very romantic way to spend the evening we both slept like angels, all the way to check out time. The hotel itself is large enough to take a romantic stroll late at night while admiring the artwork strung through the lobby and downstairs area. We couldn’t ask for a better night, we both felt refreshed and totally at peace. Amazing how the right ambience can change your perspective on life. The Hyatt Regency will certainly surround you and the one you love with a new enjoyment of life.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Dax892
Reviews.Content: Perfectly comfortable room, with fabulous beds. Good water pressure in the shower, and a great view. We were excited to use the hot tub but there was a group of people smoking and drinking a few feet away, so we couldn't enjoy it. Reasonably quiet, though we could hear doors slamming and people talking in the hall. Parking was the biggest problem - we didn't mind paying for it, but the Hyatt's garage was full, so we had to drive around and find parking elsewhere, then drag our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “good solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChumley
Reviews.Content: bid Priceline $39 per night plus fees. Read that there is a $16 charge for parking, parked about six blocks away near a ASU offsite building. Meters work 9am to 5pm, other times appear free. Checkin was easy, up to the room, seem to be remodeled in the last ten years. Nothing special, but nothing bad either. The pool and fitness center were next to each other. Fitness center had newer machines with video, free weights are nil except for some dumb bells. Water cooler, towels and headsets are provided, 24 hour access. I asked the desk person if there was a drugstore within walking distance, he replied no, but a Circle K was within a 10 minute walk. I would not walk in the dark for 10 minutes near downtown, I would suggest the same to you. The bagel store in the lobby was open and overpriced, but convenient. I scored another parking space on the street the next evening, three block walk. The hotel was busy with a convention going on. Bar and restaurant in the lobby and also across the street. There was a breakfast place, First Watch, about one block away towards First Street. I had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTucsonans
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for one week. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The only element of the room that was less then desirable was the manner in which the furniture was arranged. The desk faces was in an awkward postion and had poor lighting. There is also not a place to eat in the room other than the desk and if you are staying for business and needing to work and eat, this makes it difficult. Since my stay was in the summer, many of the hotel restaurants were closed. This made it difficult to get something to eat after work, unless you are willing to walk arounf downtown Phoenix at night. The roomservice was mediocre and per usual very exspensive. Overall, not a horrible experience but not the best. It was a wonderful hotel to work in due to it being extremely quiet/

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: Persnickety-traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and comfortable but the carpet appeared worn and dated. It costs $20 to just walk into the Business Center . . . that was a first. Good conference arrangements, employees very nice. A good deal of outside noise - typical of being located downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great underated Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: I don't know why others had given bad reviews of this hotel, or AAA's 3 diamond rating-it is one of the best Hyatts I have stayed in. It is well-maintained and clean and is the closest to the convention center. The sportsbar, Networks, has good food, atmosphere, and beer selection. We used our Hyatt Gold Passport points for the 3-day stay and they upgraded us up to a suite in the corner of the hotel on a high floor. Maids were thorough and cleaned the rooms well. There is an Einstein Brothers Bagel Cafe that stays open until 8:00 PM and has a good selection of bagels, salads, and great coffee. We were well-treated while there and no one tried to steer us to a private car company.

Reviews.Title: “a few tips”
Reviews.Author: Bramalei
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on a business trip -- the hotel is perfectly reasonable and clean. Having stayed here as long as I have, I have a few tips -- 1) Don't pay $12.29/day for internet - there's free internet in the convention center across the street, as well as at many of the area's restaurants. 2) Don't pay $5.29 for the in-room bottle of Aquafina -- there's a 5-gallon jug of Arrowhead spring water in the hotel's Exercise room, which is open 24 hours a day. 3) Don't use the hotel's "Printme.com" service - which costs $1/page after the first two pages (which are free). Instead, email your printing requests to the UPS Store downstairs, which prints for $0.10/page. 4) If you get coffee at Einstein's Coffee (in the lobby), save your coffee cup -- you can use it for the duration of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: amarie2
Reviews.Content: I rated the hotel a three because of the difficulty in access and the disturbing amount of lint on the ceiling... all this considering the price, as well as the availability of local dining. I visited this hotel being entirely unfamiliar with the Phoenix area. Since I arrived after dark, I only circled once to find parking, when there was none, I used the valet to simplify my life a bit ($23 overnight). The following day, I parked my car in the only lot that seemed to allow Hyatt guests, and I was charged a $10 flat rate each time I would come and go. This lot does not charge by the amount of time you stay. During my 3 day visit, I've spent nearly $100 in parking fees (the lot where I am working also charges, however not as much). Granted, many business travelers will be refunded this expense from their companies, but for those traveling for pleasure, realize and budget this extra expense. The nearby resturaunts are very decent. I was most pleased by the bar and grill located off the lobby of the hotel: Networks Bar and Grill. The Networks salad is great. The other resturaunts in the hotel seemed too formal and I never visited either of them. The room was overall very well cleaned, however it wasn't until the very last night of my visit that I noticed quite a large amount of lint that had accumulated on the ceiling (from the a/c which maybe needed a new filter). It didn't look like it had been cleaned in quite a while. The bed was very firm, and while some prefer this, I don't. I had trouble getting to sleep. The room was, however, VERY quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: JayJayBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Phoenix at the end of our roadtrip through Arizona. We purchased a king room at the Hyatt Regency on Hotwire for $66+fees per night. Probably a steal for this impressive hotel! Fortunately I thought to inquire about parking before we arrived, but the parking was still a bit of a hassle. You can valet park for over $20 with in and out privileges, or park yourself at a nearby garage (on the next block) for $10, or $16 with in and out privileges. In and out privileges at the garage are purchased through the front desk of the hotel and charged to your room. Does that make sense? Our 5th floor room was really nice with a down comforter, a desk, a desk chair, an armchair, a table, a armoire with a cable TV, a coffeemaker, and a hairdryer. But unfortunately, it did not have a refrigerator, and interestingly, the TV was at an angle such that you could not watch from the bed. The room overlooked the pool/lounge area on the third floor. It was a very nice hotel, but it seemed to lack character after visiting other charming hotels and cabins across Arizona. Since we were staying only one night, we also didn’t have the opportunity to fully explore what the hotel and the neighboring area had to offer (although it’s right downtown, near a thriving nightlife area, and just blocks from the Diamondbacks stadium).

Reviews.Title: “What a regal hotel”
Reviews.Author: wantingbetterservice
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency is a traditional service hotel - fully staffed and fully professional. This is a great hotel for business travel. The hotel's Internet is top-notch, providing high-speed, low latency connection. The rooms are quiet, and what you'd expect from a full-service hotel. Having a bar and grill in the lobby is nice, although they closed earlier than I thought a bar would, and I had to order my food to take to the room because it was close to closing. The hotel, although downtown, had nice access to parking nearby. * cleanliness above average * beds average * staff average (would give higher marks if I could have eaten in the grill) * Internet above average (6Mbps down, <50ms latency to yahoo.com) * air conditioning above average (didn't notice 110+ degrees) * price average * location above average (easily accessed from airport)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sketchy321
Reviews.Content: This was one of the priciest hotels on our trip, at $269 American a night for a room with a king size bed. But it was worth it, in terms of comfort and style. This is one sophisticated hotel -- decorated all in dark tones. Everything looks very executive. There's a lot of art (including sculptures) in the cavernous lobby. The room looked classy and upscale, the bed was super comfortable! One inconvenient aspect of this hotel, was the parking. We had to leave our car in a nearby lot (across the street). I believe it cost extra, can't remember how much. Made us a little nervous, as we didn't know the city well! However, being right downtown was neat. A downtown ambassador wandered by and gave us some advice and a map (very helpful!). We had dinner at the restaurant built into the hotel (Networks Bar and Grill), and then walked over to Chase Field to catch the Diamondbacks in action. Overall, a comfortable and luxurious stay...and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downtown Hyatt!!”
Reviews.Author: Katsandcards_8
Reviews.Content: My wife 2 kids and I spent the July 4th weekend in Phoenix. The Hyatt is downtown - right in the middle of the city. Very short walk to see a Diamondbacks or Suns game, shops/restaurants are nearby. Pool and gym are sort of small, but both were well maintained and clean. There is a sports bar in the hotel that offers good happy hour specials and late night meals. Also a Einstein Bros just off the lobby. Hotel staff was very courteous. The only negative over 4 days - we had to ask the maid to clean out our tub better since it had a dirt ring when we arrived. It was cleaned while we went to dinner and the mgr gave us 2 breakfast coupons. Otherwise no problems. We had a great stay and would go back to this Hyatt again. PS - If you're looking for activities, we did a Diamondbacks game, WaterWorld water park, and the Ponderosa Stables dinner sunset ride. We also did fireworks at Tempe Towne Lake. All were awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinderella4jc
Reviews.Content: We came in at 1:00 am and checked out at 8:00am so it was a short stay, but we were impressed with the hotel, we would stay there again at a better price. Paid 149.00 Auto Club discount. I'm sure it can be booked elsewhere for cheaper. Beautiful lobby would have loved to lounge for awhile but no time. Very polite staff throughout. Close to ASU downtown campus , walking distance if not hot out, we were there for my son's orientation. Awesome view of Chase field and all of Phoenix. Awesome, great beds,wish we could take them home with us. We are usually a Hilton family, but this is our second time staying at Hyatt and we may be switching. Only downside, parking structure is across small street and you have to take elevator down from garage and walk across street to hotel, but ok. Starbucks just across street, oh yeah! Next time we'll stay longer to enjoy hotel and surrounding areas to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the car service scam”
Reviews.Author: pdquick
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here for a conference. Tonight, a group of 13 of us got together for dinner at a local restaurant. We asked the bellman for cabs. Limousines arrived. Some in our party specifically asked why we had limousines instead of cabs. The bellman told us these were cabs. A couple of us who had been out around the town already remarked that we had not seen cabs in the city, and we thought maybe this was another of the weird surreal things about this very weird surreal city. In hindsight, we should have been more wary. We were being screwed. Of course these weren't cabs. There was no meter, just an announcement of a charge at the end of the trip. The limos cost a total of $95 plus tips to take us about 5 miles. At the end of our meal, we asked for cabs, and got...cabs! Total fare: $39 plus tips. We confronted the bellman, who first said we had asked for limos. We were clear that we had not. Then he said he was using "our regular car service," but said that we had been overcharged. We protested that the problem wasn't just that we had been overcharged, but that in fact we had gotten what we did not ask for and that we were not dealt with honestly. He told us we were free to talk to the manager. We did so. The manager apologized, but when I asked him directly what the hotel's policy was on calling limos when guests asked for cabs, he denied that this was their practice. However, in discussing the issue with other conference attendees, it seems that consistently guests who ask for cabs are being ushered into limos, and then stuck with bills at the end of the trip. I have seen the limo/cab scam elsewhere. it's not unique to this hotel. I wouldn't be surprised if there's a kickback involved. But guests have a right to be treated fairly, not be hustled into scams, and to be able to trust our hosts. The Phoenix Hyatt failed on all counts. I won't be coming back. If you must stay here and need a cab rather than a limo, be sure to be explicit with the bellman, and don't get into a car without a meter unless you negotiate on price up front. Know also that cab fares are relatively low, so you should probably expect to pay less than you might think.

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the best Hyatts”
Reviews.Author: MHS8874
Reviews.Content: The hotel is aging, but somewhat gracefully. The biggest issue is the lighting in the bathroom. The small. inadequate fixtures provide about as much light at the mirror as a single candle. Shaving was by feel, not by sight. There rest of the room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: R_Bear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt at the end of March and suppose I should start with the good. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean. The bad should start at the beginning. Don't help yourself to the bottled water that's on the desk when you walk into your room. It is $5.25 a bottle. Instead, go back down to the ground floor and get it at Einstein's Cafe for $3.00. Don't count on getting any really hot water out of the tap. No matter what time of day or night I tried, the best the 16th floor would produce was lukewarm - too cool for comfortable shaving. It did make adjusting the shower easy, though; I just turned it on to maximum hot and it was barely warm enough. In-room coffee pots are standard in most hotels, but the Hyatt cheaps out with the little 1-cup-at-a-time jobbies that use the innstant coffee packs. Yuck! Bring your own headlamp if you intend to read. The lighting in the rooms is little better than a candle in a cave. If you are a government traveler, forget about your beancounter's insistence that you use the tax-free number for your agency - the desk will not recognize any but Arizona state agency tax-exempt status. Forget about a courtesy shuttle from and to the airport - it is far less expensive to use a regular taxi. The bathroom fans must hold the record for noisiness! Go ahead and sing while showering - nobody will hear you over the fan's noise. In-room internet access in sincredibly expensive at $10.95 a day. I could go on, but this should suffice to persuade you that any of the other nearby hotels are a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Dadecat
Reviews.Content: Attended a business meeting in downtown Phoenix and stayed at Hyatt. Great location; easy walking distance to many attractions in downtown Phoenix. Short shuttle ride from Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. Had a room on the 21st floor with great view of the city. Beds were heavenly and covered with light down comforter. The only negative is you have to pay $12.95 for a day for internet access. Would have thought this would be complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Safe downtown Area - Coffee Hi-jinx”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a conference. It is located within a short walk to the USAirways Center ( Phoenix Suns basketball) and Chase Field ( Arizona Diamondbacks baseball) also near some of the Civic Center/auditoriums for concerts. Many good restautrants of all types within 2-3 blocks. When you go out in the day or night, you'll notice MANY City emplyees who are there to give directions and provide a feeling of safety. They, like the hotel staff, are also very friendly - a good experience, especially for the heart of a city. There is valet parking at the hotel ($16). I self-parked at a Visitor Center garage next door - $10/day with no in & out privileges. The hotel will "validate" for in & out privileges but that's another $6. Relatively small - but new and clean gym with fee weights and cross-trainers, treadmills and bikes - personal TV's and headphones. Conference rooms were spacious, well-lit, good sound. Function food was average. The funny thing was that I could not get a decent cup of coffee at this hotel. The housekeeping staff kept stocking me up with de-caf only; the function coffee just wasn't very good. And the Einstein's Bagels in the hotel had Vanilla Hazelnut in the dispenser labeled "French Roast". There is a Starbucks in the Civic Center across the street and I'm sure there are some good coffee places nearby. The rooms were very clean and mine was quite large; and the Beds were A-plus comfy. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dredlockesq
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a very nice hotel and I would recommend it to anyone going to Phoenix. It is located right in the heart of downtown and is within walking distance to both the Diamondbacks and Suns stadiums. The thing that impressed me the most was how friendly the staff was. The concierge was amazing, helping us with everything from getting a rental car to giving us excellent entertainment recommendations. The area around the hotel is safe and quiet. And the rooms were exquisite. Definately a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, 3 of which were on points, and if this is how Hyatt rewards its frequent customers, the corporation is in trouble. My room was a cave, looking out at a large gray concrete wall. Very small. Hotel has a card on the desk stating they are "environmentally friendly" and if you want your towels and linens changed, to call the hotel operator. I did so immediately, and was transferred from one person to another and finally to the front desk, who noted my request. My linens were never changed during my stay. Room service breakfast trays were still on the floor in the hallway when I returned to my room in the evening. I was there for a meeting, so the location was convenient, but there is really nothing around for dining out without having a car. A really disappointing Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place; great weekend rate”
Reviews.Author: GFKelly
Reviews.Content: We got a real cheap rate, as we were going to Arizona in August. We were in town to see the Diamondbacks, and the ballpark is in reasonable walking distance, even in the (dry) heat. The arena is also nearby. The front desk was real helpful, and the doormen were helpful. There is nothing as far as food after midnight at the hotel or anywhere close to the hotel, whcih can be a bummer. The pool was nice, though it is not for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “standard average”
Reviews.Author: lat13
Reviews.Content: One of the cheapest Hyatts around but still delivers the standard-average dose of cookie-cutter, chain appointments and service. The only thing really distinctive about the property is the revolving restaurant, which though pricey for Phoenix does offer nice views of the sprawling accidental metropolis. The main annoyances were the nit-picky charges for valet parking and internet access, $19 and $12 respectively, and the disingenous notes posted in the room about various exorbitant convenience charges and the chain's purported "concern for the environment" as a motivation for not washing towels and bedding. Note: Navigating Downtown Phoenix is challenging currently due to ubiquitous construction for the new light-rail lines.

Reviews.Title: “Medicore Hyatt Regency”
Reviews.Author: 4ofakindLasVegas
Reviews.Content: This is the worst Hyatt Regency I have ever stayed at. The hotel rooms do not have the new "Hyatt Beds" and Egyptian towels. Our room looked like a throw back from the 80's. Bathroom was very small. Hotel needs renovation to get back to Regency standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
